loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is happy to have a chance to cooperate with Kiva lenders for the second time, and he hopes his request will be accepted this time also. Ara lives in the city of Kapan of the Syunik region. He lives there with his wife and retired mother. His wife now works as babysitter, and Ara is still engaged in providing taxi services in the entire district of Syunik using his own car. 

This time Ara is requesting this loan as his mother has some health problems. This loan need is very urgent, and will be greatly helpful since with it Ara will cover his mother’s medical wastes.

loans.use: to cover his mother’s medical wastes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is aged 36 years. She is married with five children aged between 1 and 12 years. Three of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 18 years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is aged 45 years. She is married with seven children, aged between 1 and 20 years. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 24 years. Also her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
26-year-old Azhar has been running a school ever since he completed his education. His mother (also shown in the photo) started the school 18 years ago, and gradually, Azhar has been running it himself. Like his mother, Azhar knows that the only road to success is through hard work and dedication. Today, there are over 200 students in the school, of which half are girls. Azhar is determined to continue to improve and expand his school. 

He requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to conduct necessary repairs and renovate the school building to provide his students with a comfortable learning environment.

loans.use: to conduct necessary repairs and renovate the school building to provide his students with a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Hakem

texts.en:
Hakem sells phones accessories such as rechargers, batteries, covers, headphones, and other items on one of the streets of Taiz, Yemen. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more phones accessories to expand his business. This loan will make Hakem able to attract a lot of customers, which will make his profits increase. 

Hakem will use the profits resulting from this loan to purchase some expensive phones of brands such as Galaxy and iPhone to resell. His trade will increase, and he will need to hire workers to help him in his business. By this loan, Hakem believes the living condition of his family will improve.

Hakem looks forward to opening another branch to sell expensive phones while still selling accessories.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories to expand his business

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 39-year-old married woman. For about 10 years, she has been working doing machine embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to build a clientele that allows her to contribute to her household's expenses. 

To help continue business operations, she has taken out a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishing her embroidery. This will enable her to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishing her embroidery.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, age 55, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals, with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she has requested a loan of Murabaha of 35,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as calves and baby goats.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as calves and baby goats.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is 44 years of age. Her great skill in machine embroidery and experience of eight years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her embroidered cloth has grown, and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her family.

Naheed has now requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR, with which she wants to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames, and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames, and tracing paper.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, age 55, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.name: Al Barakeh Group

texts.en:
Amira is the featured borrower of Al Barakeh Group; she and the other group members decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to develop their family's living and businesses.

Amira is a 45-year-old married mother of six children who has been working baking Sajj bread and the traditional Manakish for 25 years to support her husband in making their living, and in covering their children's increasing needs.

She used to provide cleaning services in the houses of others to support her family, but her health can't support that anymore, so she started her own baking business.

Amira is working hard on developing her business, but her income isn't enough for covering her family's needs and developing her business at the same time, so for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary raw materials to develop her business, such as flour, oil, sugar, gas, paper and bags.

Amira is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Maha is the first from the right, and Sajida is the lady at the center of the picture.

loans.use: To buy the necessary raw materials to develop her business such as flour, oil, sugar, gas, paper and bags

loans.name: 25 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Yovanna es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por el gran crecimiento del comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas y por los orígenes de su población proveniente de tribus ‘Ayoreas’ nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país, de clima tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Yovana es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos,  estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el español y habla guaraní por herencia familiar (al centro, viste blusa rosada). Debido a la necesidad de continuar ampliando su negocio formó una banca de personas con negocios similares como; librería, venta de comida, venta de jugos hervidos, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de mantillas y venta de ropa deportiva, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al transporte como taxi y sus tres hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela los menores todavía están al cuidado de la madre y no están en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina, que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es un la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, como; refrescos, pan, arroz, harina, fideo, leche, azúcar, huevo, papel higiénico, etc. Actividad que realiza en su domicilio de lunes a domingo desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta últimas horas de la noche. “mi negocio crece y mis clientes aumentan, los productos que vendo se terminan y debo surtir mi negocio continuamente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra en una zona muy poblada de mucho comercio, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer y surtir su stock. Su sueño es tener una tienda amplia y poder vender por mayor y menor, y desea abastecer su negocio realizando la compra de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad por mayor para surtir su stock y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yovanna solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad por mayor para surtir su tienda y continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Yovanna is a 29 year old woman who is married and has 3 children aged 8, 4 and 2 years old. Her business is selling food and basic needs items in her neighborhood store. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, generous, responsible and very hard-working. She works in the 'Plan 3000' area which is characterized by it's great growth of commerce and manufacturing of all types and for the origin of it's inhabitants, coming from the Ayoreas native tribes of the area and miners relocated from the West of the country. It has a tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Yovanna is dark-skinned, long black hair that she ties back, dark eyes, medium stature and medium build. Her mother tongue is Spanish but she speaks Guaranidue to her her family heritage. (In the photo she is in the center, wearing a rose-colored blouse). Due to the need to continue expanding her business eh formed a communal bank with other people with businesses like: a bookstore, food sales, the sale of boiled juices, the sale of second hand clothing, the sale of shawls, and selling sports clothing to request a loan and improve their businesses.

She lives her life with her husband who drives a taxi and her 3 children. The oldest studies at school and the other two are still under the care of their mother as they are not of school age. They live in a rented house made of brick and cement with a metal roof. It has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her business is selling food and basic need items from her neighborhood store like soft drinks, bread, rice, flour, pasta, milk, sugar, eggs, toilet paper, etc. Her store is at her house and she works from Monday to Sunday from the early hours of the morning until late at night. “ My business is growing and the number of clients is increasing, the product I have sell out and I continually have to stock my store,” she comments. Her business's advantage is that it is located in a populated area with a lot of commerce. Her disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock and supply her store. Her dream is to have a large store and be able to sell both retail and wholesale.

She wants to stock her store buying food and basic needs items to satisfy her customer's needs. This is her second loan with the institution in the 3 years she has had her store. For these reasons Yovanna is requesting a loan to buy food and basic needs items wholesale to stock her store and continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy food and basic need items wholesale to stock her store and continue with her work.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. He lives there with his parents (pensioners), his wife and two sons. Nver’s wife works at the kindergarten. 

Never is also employed; he works as a fireman and simultaneously he runs a farm. He is very good at beekeeping (he has 50 bee families) and also swine breeding (6 pigs). With the help of his father, who taught him all the secrets of bee keeping, Nver now sells honey of the highest quality. Nver also sells pork to the city butchers, who are his regular customers, every two or three days. 

Nver needs this loan, as he has decided to further develop his beekeeping. With this loan amount, he will buy 10 beehives, frames and wax paper.

loans.use: to buy 10 beehives, frames and wax paper

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel Ángel tiene 65 años de edad, es agricultor, ya que desde muy niño se vio obligado a dejar la escuela para ayudarle a su papá con el fin de generar ingresos al hogar, porque era y sigue siendo la agricultura el único medio de ingresos al hogar. Es conocido en el barrio como un señor sumamente trabajador, como vendedor de hortalizas y tubérculos de calidad. Cuenta con cultivo de café, siembra de hortalizas, crianza de cerdos y gallinas. La papa chiricana es su fuerte en este momento, actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas cultivadas con esta papa.
Tiene 5 años y seis meses de dedicarse fuertemente a este cultivo de papa chiricana, actualmente está en trámites para poder exportar sus productos. Necesita este crédito para invertir en compra de semillas y fertilizantes para mantener correctamente este cultivo.
Esta papa la vende a diferentes comerciantes de la zona de San Carlos, ya que en esa zona esta papa es más reconocida y consumida por los pobladores. Los camiones llegan hasta la finca donde don Miguel Ángel prepara el kilo de papa. Por el momento no existe competencia en la zona, de todas maneras don Miguel asegura que lo cultivado es de muy alta calidad. 
Los fertilizantes que utiliza no son tan fuertes para afectar el medio ambiente, lo que utiliza es muy orgánico, aparte que cuenta con un pequeño biodigestor para los desechos de los cerdos.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 65 years old and a farmer. When he was very young he had to leave school to help his father to generate an income for the household since farming was and continues to be the only form of household income. 

Miguel Ángel is known in his neighbourhood as an extremely hardworking man and sells leafy vegetables and tubers. He has coffee and leafy vegetable crops and raises pigs and hens. The chiricana potato is the strongest seller at the moment so he has cultivated three hectares of this variety of potato. For five and a half years he has worked very hard on this chiricana potato crop and at the moment he is in negotiations to export his products. 

Miguel Ángel needs a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertiliser to ensure his crops are adequately maintained. He sells this potato to different vendors in the San Carlos area since it is more well known and consumed by the residents there. The trucks come right up to the farm where Miguel Ángel prepares the potatoes by the kilo. At the moment he has no competition in the area but regardless Miguel assures us that his crop is very high quality. The fertiliser that he uses is not strong enough to affect the environment since what he uses is very organic. Apart from that he also has a small biodigestor to treat the pig waste.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and maintain his chiricana potatoes

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Doña Adela es una mujer nicaragüense, de 50 años de edad, hace 23 años se vino a vivir a Costa Rica junto con sus 5 hijos que en ese entonces eran menores de edad. Actualmente solo vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas menores que están cursando la secundaria académica. Doña Adela y su esposo se esfuerzan mucho con el fin de darles el estudio. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y este es su tercer crédito. Desde hace más de 8 años se dedica al comercio ambulante, vende ropa, joyería, zapatos, perfumes y cosméticos.  
Gracias a los financiamientos anteriores logró incorporar una nueva actividad que es la venta de jeans colombianos, además de fortalecer su patrimonio.
Ella vende en forma ambulante atendiendo a clientas que trabajan en negocios, empresas y amas de casa, en Moravia y otras comunidades. Gracias a la variedad de productos que ofrece su negocio, le permite tener estabilidad en el volumen de ventas, ya que ofrece mercadería de acuerdo a la época, por ejemplo en febrero el fuerte son los perfumes y en diciembre la ropa. Su buen trato con el cliente y facilidades de pago la diferencian de sus competidores. Este negocio es la oportunidad para ella y su familia de generar ingresos adicionales, contribuir a los gastos del hogar y principalmente apoyar con los estudios de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Adela is a Nicaraguan woman, 50 years old, who came to live in Costa Rica 23 years ago with her 5 children who then were young. Currently, she only lives with her husband and their two youngest daughters who are in secondary school. Adela and her husband work hard to provide them with an education. She is characterized as a very hard-working woman and this is her third loan. For more than 8 years she has worked as a street vendor, she sells clothing, jewelry, shoes, perfumes and cosmetics.

Thanks to the previous loans, she managed to establish a new business which is selling Colombian jeans, in addition to strengthening her assets. She sells them as a street vendor, serving customers who work in businesses and are housewives in Moravia and other communities. Thanks to the variety of products that her business offers, she is able to have stability in the volume of sales, since she offers merchandise according to the season, for example in February, the strength is perfumes and, in December, clothing. Her good customer service and terms of payment distinguish her from her competition. This business is the opportunity for her and her family to generate additional income, contribute to the household expenses and primarily support her daughters' education.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, jewelry and jeans.

loans.name: Donya

texts.en:
Donya is studying sociology in her last year. She is 24 years old, and lives in Irbid with her family. She is studying so she can excel and feel like a successful professional; she hopes to find good work with a good salary.

Donya is working hard to make something of her life and to be able to help her family through her career.

She is asking for this loan so that she can pay her university tuition and be able to continue with her studies and achieve her and her family's dreams.

loans.use: To pay her university tuition and be able to continue her studies

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper, 39, is a brilliant and resilient smallholder mixed-farmer from Siongiroi, located in the south rift area of Kenya. Even at her age, she is still a caring mum who is committed to her husband. For the past five years, the couple's primary income sources have been milk, eggs and crops. 

Risper is seeking a loan to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. The cow she wants may be pricier than dominant breeds, but she will get real value for her money when it comes to milk production. Risper will also be able to get more cow dung for manure and fuel. With your loan, she will kill two birds with one stone: increased milk production and reduced costs. This will greatly boost her profit margin and thus her income. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Risper replied, "My family will get food and more income, and thus better living."

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. For the past three years, she and her husband (also shown in the photo) have been running a business buying and selling livestock. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

In order to expand her earnings, Shehnaz has requested from Murabaha a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more animals such as calves and heifers for resale purposes. 

She is hopeful that expanding the business will help improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as calves and heifers for resale purposes.

loans.name: Obra Group

texts.en:
Obra Group is beginning their second loan with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of five members who have businesses selling groceries, bread, tooth paste, soap and bags. The loan that they are taking out will benefit each one of the small business merchants in the group. 

Vida tells us that she joined ID-Ghana barely one and half years. She currently has a business selling bags. She started this business six years ago. After some time, she decided to expand her business with a small amount of capital. 

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her working capital. She will purchase assorted bags from the market to sell to customers. 

This type of work allows her to generate the resources that she needs to support her family. She is married and has two children; one is in school, and the younger is seven months old. 

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that in addition to receiving the loan, she likes the health focus that the institution offers.

loans.use: To purchase assorted bags from the market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Essozimna

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants, Essozimna est âgée de 37 ans. Elle vit dans le quartier de Ségbé et vend des produits de beauté et des tapettes en se promenant dans les quartiers pour répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients. Essozimna s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché afin de disposer de ses articles. Pour améliorer son activité, Essozimna demande ce crédit pour commander des tapettes afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour accomplir ses attentes.
texts.en: Being a married woman and mother of three children, Essozimna is 37 years old. She lives in the neighborhood Ségbé and sells beauty products and flipflops by walking in the neighborhoods to respond to requests from her customers. Essozimna stocks up three times per month at the market in order to have her goods available. In order to improve her activity, Essozimna asks for this credit to order some flipflops so as to have the necessary profit to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: to buy five dozen flipflops

loans.name: Ekome Feemo Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Ekome Feemo. They are into banku, tea and bread, cloth, ready-made goods, fried yams and turkey tail. They live in traditional families in Teshie, Accra, Ghana. These members have joined the microfinance institution ID Ghana in order to successfully carry out their trading activities. 

Mary, a member of the group, sells cooked food (banku, tea and bread, and porridge). In the photo, she is standing on the right. She plans to use her loan to buy corn and cassava dough to prepare banku, as well as milk, tea bags, Milo, and sugar to prepare tea and bread, and porridge to sell to customers. She is expecting to make good profit. Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and contribute to her large family's daily expenses.

Her business base is broad, so she definitely needs financial assistance to expand her business, as do her compatriots.

loans.use: To buy corn and cassava dough to prepare banku, milk, tea bags, Milo, sugar to prepare tea and bread, and also porridge to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 46-year-old married father of three children, who has been working in a shoe factory since 1980. His limited monthly salary is his only source of income for his family, since he is their sole breadwinner. Thus, for this reason he is acquiring a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua, to pay his children's increasing school tuition fees. 

Kassem hopes to provide his children with the best education to make sure they can benefit from a brighter future. He hopes that he can develop his career for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to pay his children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Jeannete

texts.en:
Jeannete is 45 years old. She is married with six children between two and nineteen years old. Four of them go to school. Jeannete is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 21 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a smallholder farmer in Kitale. Kitale produces maize, which is Kenya’s key export commodity. Small farmers in this area work on maize farms for wages, but practice dairy farming in their own homes, and indeed Evans relies on dairy farming to provide for his family. He has engaged in this activity for seven years and notes that “dairy farming does not require special skills to succeed.” 

Evans is a hard-working, persevering, and determined husband and father, and the biggest challenge he has encountered so far is lack of an available market, since most farmers already keep dairy cows. He is therefore seeking a loan in order to venture into poultry farming. This venture will help him increase his income, diversify his portfolio, and mitigate risks associated with dairy farming. Your loan will also help him deal with the high farming costs that are eating into his profits. 

Evans's end game is to provide a decent standard standard of living for his wife and child.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Annonciathe

texts.en:
Annonciathe is 43 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 3 and 20 years, 4 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 23 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay school fees for her children. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is effected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a smallholder farmer living in the village of Lessos, about 25 kilometers from the rural town of Nandihills. Lessos has stayed largely under-developed, and the village farmers persistently follow traditional cultivation practices, mostly preferring to cultivate tea. Instead, Pius practices dairy farming, choosing to refrain from tea farming with the objective of improving his socio-economic status. The prevailing geological conditions of the village make it extremely suitable for dairy farming. 

The major challenge he faces is lack of the funds necessary to push his dairy farming a notch higher. Therefore, Pius is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. This additional cow will help in the use of pasture, increase milk production, and improve dairy availability for producing more byproducts. Through this loan, Pius will be able to challenge the existing norms and bring better and more advanced dairy farming practices to his village, thus becoming a torchbearer for change in his village for others to follow. 

His goal is to use your loan investment wisely so that he can ultimately raise the standard of living for his wife and their three children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en:
Emeline is 45 years old. He is married with four children aged one to eleven years, and two of them go to school. Emeline is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 12 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of their children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Blanca Nely

texts.es:
Blanca, de 39 años de edad, está casada desde hace quince años, es madre de una niña de 6 años de edad, que estudia primer grado, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura (siembra granos básicos, maíz y frijoles) y también trabaja en la albañilería.

Blanca, trabaja todos los días tejiendo hamacas de seda y de poliseda, este arte se lo enseño su hermano menor, cuando el aprendió en un taller que impartió una ONG que llegó a su comunidad.- Además se dedica a la sastrería desde 1991, cuando su hermana mayor le enseño ha coser, decidió dedicarse a estos trabajos, debido a la necesidad económica y porque también tenia que apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la familia.- Ella, también se ha dedicado a la crianza de especies menores, como aves de corral y cerdos que engorda, para luego ir a venderlos en las plazas de la ciudad. 

Blanca, solicita el crédito para comprar tres cerdos valorados en $50.00 cada uno, los cuales engordará en un periodo de cinco a seis meses, para luego venderlos.- También, invertirá $150.00 en la compra hilo de seda y de poliseda, para seguir tejiendo hamacas, para venderlas en la comunidad y por encargo.
Así podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida con la venta de los cerdos y espera obtener mejores ingresos de las ventas de las hamacas.

El sueño de Blanca, es ver a su hija convertida en una profesional, pues ella quiere ser una enfermera cuando sea grande, es por eso que de sus ganancias en la ventas de hamacas, sastrería y crianza de especies menores, ahorra para darle lo mejor que pueda a su hija y su familia.

Además, le gustaría poner su propio taller de sastrería en la comunidad, es para comprar una mejor maquina de cocer.
texts.en:
Blanca is 39 years old and has been married for 15 years. She has a six-year-old daughter who is in first grade at school. Blanca’s husband is a farmer; he grows basic grains, corn and beans, while also working in the building trade.

Blanca works every day producing hammocks with silk and other materials. Her younger brother taught her this trade, and he learned it at a workshop given by an NGO that came to the community. Blanca has also been working in dressmaking since 1991 when her sister taught her to sew. Blanca decided to work in this trade for financial reasons as she had to help her husband to pay family expenses. Blanca also raises young animals, including poultry and pigs, which she fattens up to sell at the city markets at a later date. 

Blanca is applying for a loan in order to buy three pigs, valued at US$50 each. Blanca will fatten up the animals over a period of five to six months, and then sell them. She will also invest $150 in material and parachute silk to continue making hammocks to sell on commission and in the local community.

By selling the pigs and, she hopes, earning more from hammock sales, Blanca hopes to improve her living conditions.

Blanca’s dream is to see her daughter learn a profession. She wants her daughter to be a nurse when she grows up. Blanca saves up her profits from dressmaking and selling animals and hammocks so as to give her daughter and family the best that she can.

Blanca would also like to open her own dressmaking workshop in the community so that she can buy a better sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to fatten up over a period of five to six months; and to buy parachute silk and other material in order to continue producing hammocks.

loans.name: Manegre 05 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr GOMKOUDOUGOU est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 05 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 02 mois. 01 enfant  va à l’école et il a 06 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 17 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour construire sa parcelle. Il ambitionne  assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Gomkoudougou is head of the group “Manegre 05 Sapone”. He is married and the father of 4 children. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 2 months old. 1 child goes to school and he is in charge of 6 people. Mr. Gomkoudougou has been raising livestock for 17 years. He gets his supplies at the nearby markets. With the money granted, he will be able to buy 5 pigs. He wants to use the earnings of the loan to build his plot. He strives to assure the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs

loans.name: Ana Veronica

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y un hijo, es casada, su negocio consiste en atender una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, la cual fue fundada hace cinco años, actualmente ha incluido la venta de recargas de saldo para celular, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en bebidas, granos básicos, aceite, detergentes, boquitas, entre otros productos para diversificar las ofertas a sus clientes, espera recuperar la inversión con un mejor margen de ganancias y así poder cancelar su deuda.
Sus proyectos son incluir nuevos productos en su negocio y construir un nuevo local para tener un negocio con mejor imagen para atraer nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is married and lives with her husband and son. She has a shop selling staple goods, which she opened five years ago. Ana has also started selling mobile phone top-ups. She does not currently have any problems with her business.

Ana will use this loan to buy drinks, basic grains, oil, detergents, snacks and other products that will allow her to diversify the range of products on offer to her customers. She hopes to recover her investment with a higher profit margin and thus pay off her debt.

Ana’s plans for the future include offering new products at her business, and building new premises in order to offer a better image and attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, basic grains, oil, detergents, snacks and other products that will allow her to diversify the range of products on offer to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia, age 32, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.name: Farooq

texts.en:
Farooq is a 53-year-old married woman who, for many years, has been selling animals with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.

For the improvement of her business, she has sought a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales to generate greater revenue in the future. She dreams of building her own house though her work.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Francine

texts.fr: Francine est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans et vit à Adidogomé avec son mari et ses quatre enfants. Francine prépare des beignets à base de la farine de blé pour vendre et gagner son revenu afin de favoriser une éducation adéquate à ses enfants. Grâce à ce commerce Francine arrive à faire une bonne épargne et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans une boutique du quartier. Afin de disposer d’un stock important et vendre plus sa marchandise, Francine demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé et atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Francine is a 51-year-old married woman and lives in Adidogomeé with her husband and her four children. Francine prepares donuts with a wheat flour base to sell and earns her profit in order to support an adequate education for her children. Thanks to this business, Francine is able to make a good savings and stocks up two times per month at a shop in the neighborhood. In order to have her important stock available and to sell more merchandise, Francine asks for this loan to buy bags of wheat flour and reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of wheat flour

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 24-year-old married lady who has been working as a hairdresser for eight years. Her income helps her parents and siblings and her husband cover the needs and expenses of the family. In 2011, Zeinab established her current beauty salon. She is working hard to develop it as the best beauty salon for her customers.
To keep her salon updated, Zeinab is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy hair tools for her work and to satisfy her customers' needs.
She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her workplace and provide job opportunities for those who would like to have their own business one day.

loans.use: to buy hair tools for her work

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is 20 years old and lives in Irbid. He is single, ambitious, and helpful.  Alaa wants to achieve his goal of completing his education to be able to find work and earn a good income.

He is a student in university majoring in accounting. His father could not cover Alaa`s university fees so he requested an education loan to pay the fees.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help him cover his university fees and buy the books he needs to achieve his goals.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is 66 years old and has a tailoring shop which he has been running for 5 years. He is married and blessed with 6 children who are now grown up.

He will use the loan to purchase fabric materials for making gents and ladies clothes and hopes this will enable him meet his customers' needs and get more income to pay school fees for his children who are in college. 

He hopes to open more tailoring shops and have a prosperous business and a happy family in future.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials for making gents and ladies clothes and hopes this will enable him meet his customers' needs and get more income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a father who is working hard to do anything to provide a comfortable life to his children, and to secure all their needs. He is 53 years old and lives in Baqaa. He has six children, which means he is responsible for a large family.

Day after day, the needs of Jameel’s family have increased, and his salary could not cover all their needs, so he decided to start his own business to get more income. He opened a brick factory, and brick by brick he has built this factory.

Now he is thinking to expand his work because of the high standards of living. Also, two of his children joined the university. He is applying for a loan to help him develop and expand his work. He will use the loan to buy more machines to increase his products and to improve the quality of his products.

He said, “This loan will help me to raise my income. Then I will become able to provide a good education and life to my kids; I really need your support.”

loans.use: to buy more machines to increase his products and to improve the quality of his products.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
Abdulla is happy and satisfied with the loan that he will receive; it will help him pay his semester fees. He is a student in university majoring in journalism and he lives in Irbid.
Abdulla chose this major because he believes that he will be able to make changes in the world with this major. But his father is now unable to pay for Abdulla`s university fees; therefore, he has applied for an educational loan.
He needs your support to pay for his university fees, complete his education, start his career path and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 26 years old and has a retail shop in Mombasa town. She is married and blessed with three children. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family. She has been in this business for the past four years, and it has been profitable.

She will use the requested loan to purchase cooking fat, soft drinks, milk, maize flour, rice, and washing powder. This will enable her to serve more customers to get more income to educate her children.

She hopes to expand her retail shop and own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, soft drinks, maize flour, rice, milk, and washing powder. This will enable her to serve more customers and get more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 21 years old and lives in Rsaifeh. He is studying finance and is very ambitious with a lot of dreams he wants to achieve.
His family earns a low income and his father could not help him cover the university fees. Therefore, he decided to apply for an education loan to help him cover his semester fees and complete his education.
Samer needs your support to achieve his goals and finish his education to find good work with a good salary to be able help his family cover household expenses.

loans.use: To help him pay his semester fees and complete his education.

loans.name: Elvia Evangelina

texts.es:
Elvia, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, actualmente su hijo está estudiando cuarto grado.- No pudo continuar con sus estudios, debido a la falta de ingresos económicos y por vivir muy alejado del centro escolar.

Elvia, está trabajando en una pizzería desde hace 6 meses, antes trabajaba en una tienda y en una panadería, pero decidió cambiar de trabajo.- Actualmente, trabaja de lunes a viernes y viaja a su comunidad únicamente los fines de semana, pues por la distancia no puede viajar todos los días, tiene que alquilar un cuarto en la ciudad para poder vivir.- Además de este trabajo fijo, cuenta con una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde, en donde le apoya su mamá y su papá a cuidarlos mientras ella se va a trabajar.

El crédito anterior lo ocupa, para comprar útiles escolares y una cama para su hijo, el crédito le fue de gran utilidad.- Actualmente, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para mejorar las instalaciones de la granja que posee en su comunidad, con esto aumentará el número de pollos de engorde para venderlos a un muy buen precio.

Elvia, sueña con poder seguir trabajando arduamente para poder seguir generando ingresos económicos a su hogar e ir ahorrando para poder  tener su propia casa y ayudar a su hijo a terminar sus estudios y que llegue a ser un profesional.  Además, le gustaría tecnificar la granja de pollos de engorde.- Pues así estaría más cerca de su familia y especialmente al cuido de su hijo.
texts.en:
Elvia, 24 years old, went to school until sixth grade. She is a single mother and has a 10-year-old son who is currently in fourth grade. Elvia was not able to continue going to school because of lack of income and the fact that she lived very far away from the school.

Elvia has been working at a pizzeria for 6 months. Previously she worked in a shop and a bakery, but she decided to change jobs. She currently works from Monday through Friday and travels to her home town only on weekends; because of the distance, she cannot commute every day, so she has to rent a room in the city. In addition to this permanent job, she has a small chicken farm; her mother and father help her by taking care of the chickens while she goes to work.

She used the previous loan to buy school supplies and a bed for her son; the loan was very helpful. She is currently requesting a new loan to improve the facilities of the farm she owns in her community; this will allow her to increase the number of chickens so that she can sell them at a good price.

Elvia dreams of being able to continue working hard to continue to make money for her household and to save to buy her own home; she also wants to help her son finish school and become a professional. Also, she would like to modernize her chicken farm so that she can be closer to her family and take care of her son, especially.

loans.use: to improve the facilities of the farm she owns in her community.

loans.name: Manegre 02 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr AMIDOU est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 02 DE SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 01 ans  05 mois. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Amidou is head of the group “Manegre 02 de Sapone”. He is married and the father of 6 children. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 1 year and 5 months old. 4 children go to school and he is in charge of 7 people. Mr. Amidou has been raising livestock for 20 years. He gets his supplies at the nearby markets. With the money granted, he will be able to buy 4 sheep. He wants to use the earnings from the loan to reinvest in his activity. He strives to assure the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné est une femme célibataire âgée de 30 ans et vit à Adidogomé avec un enfant. Akpéné est une femme très dynamique et entreprenante qui vend des céréales dans le quartier. Ce commerce lui permet d’avoir le revenu nécessaire pour répondre favorablement à ses besoins quotidiens. Akpéné s’approvisionne  quatre fois par mois au marché local du quartier. Akpéné demande ce crédit pour acheter les sacs de maïs et du haricot  afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et réaliser une rentabilité favorable
texts.en: Akpéné is a single 30-year-old woman and lives in Adidogomé with one child. Akpéné is a very dynamic and resourceful woman who sells grains in the neighborhood. This business allows her to have the necessary income to favorably respond to her daily needs. Akpéné gets her supplies four times per month at the local neighborhood market. Akpéné asks for this loan to buy bags of corn and beans in order to respond to requests from her customers and to achieve a favorable profitability.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of corn and 24 bowls of beans

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
This is the Noyaa group. The featured borrower of this group, Simon, age 62, sells slippers and sandals to earn an income. He started selling these items door to door in his community about six years ago in order to support his family's needs and pay for his school-going child's education. 

Simon needs to increase his income in order to cover his family's increasing expenses. He has therefore joined with fellow borrower Helina to request a loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana. He will use his loan funds to buy new slippers and sandals to offer for sale. The investment will attract new customers to his business and increase his income. 

Simon hopes to expand his business in the future and move his activities to a bigger, more permanent shop. 

He and Helina will hold one another accountable for the repayment of the total loan amount of GHS 2,900.

loans.use: to buy new slippers and sandals to offer for sale to his customers

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans Ama vit à Adidogomé avec son enfant. Etant très entreprenante et active dans le développement,  Ama fait le commerce de friperies afin de gagner sa vie par le revenu qu’elle tire. Grâce à ce commerce Ama réalise ses désirs et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de. Pour passer une commande de jupes et de corsage, Ama demande ce crédit pour faciliter son achat et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: 34 years old, Ama lives in Adidogomé with her child. Being very resourceful and active in development, Ama trades in used clothing in order to earn her living by the income that she draws. Thanks to this business, Ama fulfills her desires and gets her supplies two times per month at the market. In order to place an order of skirts and blouses, Ama asks for this loan to facilitate her purchase and achieve a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 6 dozen skirts and 3 dozen blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement to complete the house that will become his family's home

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, se esta esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder cumplir con sus sueños. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder comprar una notebook para poder hacer los trabajos de la universidad.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marlene is studying for a degree in Commercial Engineering. She is striving to make something out of her life so that she can fulfill her dreams. Marlene says that her previous loan was used to buy a notebook computer for doing her work at the university.

Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can pay her degree fees. As a result, she can continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es peluquera en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, se dedica  hace más de 9 años en su negocio, ella está casada con el Sr. Teofilo.
Ella comenta que con la ayuda de su marido pudo montar para su propio local y gracias a su ingreso puede hacer estudiar a sus  2 hijos dignamente.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, con lo cual podrá seguir con su buen servicio a su familia. Ella va a comprar tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros.
texts.en:
Maria is a beautician in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She has been in business for more than nine years. Maria is married to Sr. Teofilo.

She says that with the help of her husband, she was able to establish her own shop. Thanks to her income, Maria is able to provide a decent education for her two children.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy supplies for her beauty salon so that she can continue to provide good service and support her family. Maria will buy dyes, crèmes, shampoo, rinses, and other products.

loans.use: to buy dyes, crèmes, shampoo, rinses, and other products.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food production and vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lydia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Lydia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza is 29 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Edeliza has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future Edeliza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 38-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more gallons of coconut wine to resell. Arlene has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to resell.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Gifty prepares and sells tea and bread goods to earn her living. She has been engaged in this work for the past 10 years, and she works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. every working day. In this way, she is able to make a good monthly profit. She is in her early fifties and lives in Teshie with her husband and their one dependent child.

She is requesting her eighth loan from ID-Ghana. She will share this loan with her colleague, Florence. With her previous loans, all of which she has repaid successfully, Gifty was able to improve her business and increase her income. She invested her profits back into her enterprise and also placed a substantial amount into savings with ID-Ghana to save toward household and food expenses. 
 
Gifty will use her new loan funds to replenish her inventory with new stock. Specifically, she will buy Milo, tea bags, milk, sugar, and bread to prepare and sell to customers. She dreams of continuing to expand and improve her business. 

Gifty and Florence will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Milo, tea bags, milk, sugar, and bread to prepare and sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of tomatoes and onions to offer for sale to her customers

loans.name: Alwan

texts.en:
As you can see in the photo, one of the Yemeni residents who lives in Taiz is Alwan. He is building a new house that isn't completed. It needs a lot of construction materials to build its rooms, in addition to a kitchen and bathroom, and then renovate them. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do so.

For this loan, he applied for 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction supplies, such as cement, bricks, and iron, to complete building his house and to renovate it from the inside.

This loan will help him to complete all the building of his house and make it ready for living. His five children will live in a spacious house, as Alwan plans to make it. With this loan, Alwan will support his family with a better living condition.

Alwan hopes to build a second floor and rent it for a monthly payment.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies, such as cement, bricks, and iron, to complete the building of his house and to renovate it.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 38, sells grocery items to earn an income. She has operated this business since 2012, and offers for sale such items as milk, Milo, sugar, powdered milk, fruit juice, canned tomatoes, and sardines. 

She and her husband live in an apartment in Teshie with their three children.

This will be Agnes's seventh loan, and her loan funds will allow her to buy a stock of popular grocery items that will help her meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy a stock of popular grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a biogas system for renewable cooking energy for her family.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 46 years old. He is single and has no child. He has had a butchery business for 10 years. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of meat to sell to more customers. He hopes this will enable him to get more income, which he could use to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to open other butcher shops and be a successful businessman and family man.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of meat to sell to more customers, which he hopes will enable him to get more income with which to expand his business.

loans.name: Khadisa

texts.ru: Это женщина Хадиса. Она мать одиночка и проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 53 года. Хадиса развелась с мужем и сына вырастила  одна. У нее есть один сын. Он учится в университете. Хадиса занимается растениеводством больше 20 лет.  Для нее данная деятельность является единственным источником дохода. Она каждый сезон вместе с сыном сажают урожай. Работать на земле тяжело, но Хадиса не смотря ни на, что продолжает работать в этом направлении. Главный человек в ее жизни ее сын, ради него она живет и работает. Сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Для купли достаточного количество минеральных удобрений ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: This woman is Khadisa. She is a single mother and lives in the Pyandj district. She is 53 years old. She divorced her husband and raised her son alone. She has one son who is studying at university. Khadisa has been raising crops for over twenty years and this is her sole source of income. Every season she and her son plant crops. Working the land is difficult, but Khadisa does not pay attention to that and continues to do this kind of work. The most important person in her life is her son, whom she lives and works for. She currently needs to fertilize the land in order to produce a rich, high quality harvest. She does not have the money to buy enough fertilizer and this is why she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mezyan

texts.en:
Mezyan is a 55-year-old, married mother of one child. She works in the religious services domain, as she has done since twenty-two years ago. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman, who is trying hard to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children and providing them with better living conditions.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She will use it to renovate her house, to make it a healthier place.

loans.use: to renovate her house and make it a healthier place.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Гулдаста. Ей 49 лет. Она жительница района А.Джоми. Гулдаста замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее детям 25, 24 и 20 лет. Гулдаста работает в сфере сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры на своем не большом участке земли. Она посеяла урожай и теперь необходимо обработать почку минеральными удобрениями. На достаточное количество удобрений ей не хватает денег и она не видит иного выхода, чем обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: The woman in this photograph is called Guldasta. She is 49 and lives in the A. Jomi district. Guldasta is married and has three children, ages 20, 24 and 25. Guldasta works in the agricultural sphere. She plants crops on her small plot of land. She planted crops and now it is necessary to treat the soil with fertilizers. She does not have enough money to buy a sufficient amount of fertilzer and sees no other option but to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and finish planting her crops

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 36 years old. He is married and, with his spouse, has been blessed with one child, aged five years.

Thomas has had a garbage collection business for 13 years. He will use the loan to purchase polythene bags, gloves, gumboots, and overall uniforms. He hopes this will enable him to serve more residents in the area and earn more income to support his family.

This is his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he repaid his previous loans successfully. His hopes and dreams for the future are to start a waste management company.

loans.use: to purchase polythene bags, gloves, gumboots, and overall uniforms, which he hopes will enable him to serve more residents in the area.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married. She has three children, and two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for thirty years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 39 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 14 years old, three of whom go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 15 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Jose Eligio

texts.es:
José, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuidado de sus hijos, los cuales son tres y están estudiando en el centro escolar de la comunidad, además su esposa tiene una pequeña granja de gallinas ponedoras.

José, trabaja como promotor de salud desde hace más de 15 años, anterior a este empleo era agricultor y albañil, estos oficios todavía los desempeña en sus días libres y cuando le sale trabajo de ello.

El crédito lo utilizara para hacer unas mejoras en su casa, específicamente en el área del baño y la otra parte lo utilizara para comprar gallinas ponedoras y así agrandar un poquito su pequeña granja.

Ella, espera en un futuro tener bien arreglada su granja y que su casa esté totalmente terminada y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 56 years old, studied until high school, is married and his wife dedicates her time to household duties and the care of their children, who are three and are studying in the school in their community. His wife also has a small farm of egg laying hens.

José has been working as a community health advisor for more than 15 years. Before this, he was a farmer and bricklayer. He still does these jobs in his free days and when he gets offered work of those types.

He will use the loan to make some improvements to his home, specifically in the bathroom area. He will use the other part to buy egg laying hens so as to expand a little his small farm.

She [his wife] hopes to have a well-arranged farm in the future and their house totally finished so as to improve the quality of their life.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his house and to buy egg laying hens so as to expand a little his small farm

loans.name: Al- Kefah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Kefah which consists of four women and one man from Taiz city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.
Nasim, the leader of the group, is 32 years old and lives with her parents and brotherhood in a very small house which needs a suitable bathroom and kitchen. She is the oldest child of her parents who are very poor and live in miserable conditions. She decided to take a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to help her parents build a large bathroom, as well as a kitchen for their house. The house is without a kitchen and they make their food in one of the living rooms. The girls, as well as the guys, who come to the house will get a nice suitable bathroom. This loan will help make some of the necessary expansions for their house. The family will feel glad because this loan will make better living conditions.
Nasim hopes to share the home with her parents by completing all the necessary expansions for the house by building a second floor.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to help her parents build a large bathroom as well as a kitchen for their house

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 49 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 3 and 16 years old. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 28 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to raise.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business of rentals and at the same time has a motor vehicle transport business that adds to her income. She is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital that hinders progress of her business. However, she has hopes of buying more land to build more houses for her rental business. Harriet has asked for a loan to help her buy land where she will construct houses to rent.

loans.use: to buy land where she will construct houses to rent.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence, age 28, earns his living by trading in bark cloth, a traditional Ugandan textile. He started this business in 2001 and his clients are traders from the capital city. In order to better support his family, he supplements his income by working in agriculture. He works 12 hours a day, seven days a week. Lawrence lives in a rural area with his wife and their four-year-old child.

Lawrence's dream is to expand his business, but his biggest challenge is lack of sufficient capital to do so. He describes himself as a hard-working man. 

He has requested a loan in order to buy a stock of bark cloth to modify into craft items that are highly sought after by tourists. 

Lawrence is confident that he will receive a plentiful income from this investment.

loans.use: to buy bark cloth to fashion into craft items

loans.name: Kassimu

texts.en:
Kassimu is a married man, aged 34 years, with two children who are 9 and 7 years respectively. He lives in Kyotera town with his family and both of his children attend school. He deals in the fish trade and he works six days a week and each day he works for eight hours. He supplements his family income with a transport business.

He has been in this business since 2000 and his clients are fellow residents. He started this business due to the availability of a market for his goods and he has acquired this loan facility in order to buy fish to sell.

His dream is to expand his business but he still faces a lot of challenges like poor transport means and a lack of modern equipment for storing his goods. He describes himself as a hardworking man and urges Ugafode to give enough money to clients to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Patrizia

texts.en: Patrizia is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in cotton and recycled rubber accessories. She would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including cotton loops and natural dyes. Patrizia has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story: Born in Italy, Patrizia fell in love with Guatemala, its people and culture, motivating her to settle here in 2001. "I began meeting people in the world of fashion design and was fortunate to become friends with one of Guatemala's most famous designers, who has been like a mentor to me. I'm always observant of styles and trends in international fashions, which I've blended with the colors and traditions of Guatemala. I am very serious about helping the environment, so I also recycle fabrics and other materials." "Many thanks for your help! With this microcredit, I will be able to craft a new line of eco-friendly products." Use the link below to view Patrizia's cotton and recycled rubber accessories on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8082

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including cotton loops and natural dyes

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is married with two school-going children. They live in a family house that has electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Salamatu has operated a medicine business for the past five years. She sells at her residence in a shop so that her customers will know the place of her residence and can come to her anytime in need. She dreams of establishing a mini depot in the future. With this loan, she wants to purchase more medicine for resale. She decided to join ID-Ghana to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en: These women are part of the group called Peace, and Mary is the featured borrower of this group. She got together with the other group members, as they have always been neighbors and friends, to acquire a loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana. She is the main Peace group leader. They are selling general goods and second hand clothing. Mary is a 55-year-old married woman and all her children are on their own. Sixteen years ago, Mary started selling general goods. She started selling items to increase her income and improve her living conditions. Mary is working hard to develop this business as much as she can, to increase her business capital, and attract new customers. For this reason, Mary is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana, to increase her business merchandise with newly-released mosquito insecticides and coils, candles, matches, and creams. She is now well-known in her region and she is working hard to serve many customers. Mary is the woman standing on the left in the picture. Together with her friend, they will need a total amount of GHS 2,600 to increase stocks.

loans.use: To buy osquito insecticides and coil, candle, match and creams to sell to customers.

loans.name: Km 6 El Bajio Group

texts.es:
Florinda es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo  desarrolla de forma ambulante en el sur de su ciudad, un área marginada de la ciudad, casas rústicas y antiguas muchas sin acceso a agua conviven formando un lugar de manufactura y producción en todas las áreas. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Florinda es de tez trigueña, cabello largo castaño lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (sentada, viste camiseta azul y calza negra). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos, uno ya asiste a la escuela primaria y el otro aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de superación la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de huevo, venta de comida, elaboración de masitas, venta de sábanas, servicio de té, venta de fruta y tapicería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades.  Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas; Avon,  Mary Kay, Jafra y otros…, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante durante toda la semana en diferentes ferias y comercios de la ciudad. Los productos con mayor demanda son; aretes, lápiz labial, cremas anti edad, tratamientos faciales, perfumes, mascara para pestañas, etc. “inicié mi negocio vendiendo ropa y cosméticos, actualmente sólo me dedico al comercio de cosméticos y pienso ampliar mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mayoría de las ventas las realiza a pedido y por catálogo eso hace que no tenga que cargar todos sus productos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para comprar productos por mayor. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio como distribuidora de cosméticos y abrir un negocio de bisutería, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Florinda solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad y con los beneficios abrir un negocio de bisutería.
texts.en:
Florinda is a young woman, who is 20 years old. She is single and has 2 children, who are 6 and 4 years old. Her business is selling cosmetics by catalog.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, responsible, and very hard working. She started her business as a street vendor in the south of the city—a marginalized part of the city with rustic and very old houses lacking access to water and a place made up of manufacturing and production is all its areas. It has a hot, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Florinda has olive skin, long brown hair that she wears tied, brown eyes, and medium height. Her mother tongue is Spanish, and she knows the Guarani language from her family. In the picture, she is seated and is wearing a blue shirt and black pants.

She shares her life with her children. One of them attends primary school, and the other is still not of school-age. They live in their own room made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. Their home has drinkable water, electricity, and indoor plumbing. 

The need for improvement brought her to lead a bank of people with businesses such as: selling eggs, selling food, making pastries, selling sheets, serving tea, selling fruit, and doing upholstery. She does this to request a loan and to improve her work. 

Her business is selling cosmetics by catalog by traveling to meet different people. She sells the following brands: Avon, Mary Kay, Jafra, and others. She does this activity by traveling around the area during the whole week in different fairs and markets in the city. The products with the highest demand are: earrings, lip pencil, anti-aging lotions, facial treatments, perfumes, mascara, etc. 

She says that she started her business selling clothing and cosmetics but that she now only sells cosmetics. She says that she plans to grow her business. The advantage of her business is that the majority of her sales are made by order and by catalog, so she doesn’t have to carry and hold all of her products. The disadvantage of her business is the lack of capital she has for investment to buy products wholesale.
