Her dream is to grow her business as a cosmetics distributor and to open a costume jewelry business. She wants to make an investment in her business by buying a stock of seasonal cosmetics wholesale to satisfy her clients’ demand. This is her second sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that she has been doing this activity. 

It is for these reasons that Florinda requests a loan to buy cosmetics wholesale to offer more variety and with the goal of opening a costume jewelry business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale to offer more variety and with the goal of later opening a costume jewelry business.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a 21-year-old, single lady. She has been working as a secretary at a dental clinic since 2013, and she is working hard to develop her living.

Kawthar is a hard worker, who puts so much effort into developing her work and living. Her limited monthly salary is barely enough to cover her increasing living needs. For this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for an urgent dental surgery she's going to undergo.

loans.use: to pay for an urgent dental surgery that she needs

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is 24 years old. She is married with two children aged between one and four years old who do not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past five years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 37 years old. He is married with six children aged between one and fifteen years old, three of whom go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 16 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 29 years old. She is married with four children aged between one and nine years old, two of whom go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 10 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 29 years old. He is married with three children aged between two months and five years old. One of them goes to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 11 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer and pay school fees for his child. The profits from the business will be used to buy cows to raise.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
José, de 67 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos viven en E.E.U.U y su última hija de 17 años, vive con ellos y estudia bachillerato,  su esposa tiene una tienda en el caserío donde viven.

José, casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya que fue el oficio que su padre le enseño, además de ese trabajo, tiene vacas que producen leche, la cual vende y es otra fuente de ingreso para su familia.

José, utilizará el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas que cultivará este año, ya que del cultivo de cada año, tiene para cubrir el gasto personal y para la venta.

En un futuro, su sueño es hacer crecer la tienda que tiene su esposa y con la ayuda de kiva está seguro que lo  lograra.
texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old, is married, and has three children. Two of his children live in the United States, and his youngest daughter, who is 17 years old, lives with them and is studying for her high school diploma. His wife has a store in the area where they live.

Jose has spent almost all of his life dedicated to agriculture, since that was the work that his father taught him. In addition to this work, he has cows that produce milk, which he sells and is another source of income for his family.

Jose will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies for the crops he will grow this year. Since he harvests the crop every year, he has to cover his personal expenses and expenses for selling.

In the future, his dream is to help grow his wife’s store, and with the help of Kiva, he is sure that he will succeed.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for this year's harvest.

loans.name: Alfredo Isaac

texts.es:
Alfredo, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a las labores domesticas y a cuidar a su hijo.- Alfredo, vive en la casa de sus suegros y su suegro realiza labores agropecuarias desde hace mucho tiempo, en el mismo cantón donde residen.

Alfredo, actualmente es empleado en una Agro-ferreteria, en el cual desempeña el puesto de bodeguero desde hace varios años.- Anteriormente, se dedicaba a la albañilería, pero mejor decidió trabajar en dicha ferretería.- Alfredo, viaja todos los días, a su lugar de trabajo en autobús.

Alfredo, invertirá el préstamo para terminar de construir su casa, esto le servirá para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que actualmente vive con sus suegros y desea tener su propia vivienda.

Alfredo, lo que más desea en este momento, es terminar de construir su casa y darle a su familia un techo seguro para vivir comodamente, ademas desea ver crecer a su hijo y darle una buena educación.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 23 years old, and he studied through ninth grade. He is in a relationship, and his wife is dedicated to household work and to taking care of their son. Alfredo lives in his in-laws’ house, and his father-in-law has done agricultural work for a long time in the same area in which they live.

At present, Alfredo is employed in an agricultural hardware store, in which he has performed the role of shopkeeper for many years. Previously, he was working in construction, but it was for the best that he decided to work in this hardware store. Alfredo travels everyday to his place of work by bus.

Alfredo will invest the loan to finish building his house. This will help him improve his quality of life, since, at present, he lives with his in-laws and wants to have his own home.

What Alfredo wants most at this time is to finish building his house and to give his family a safe home in which to live comfortably. In addition, he wants to watch his son grow and give him a good education.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda, 28 years old, is married and has one child. She makes and sells fish and chips in her community or at the market to earn a living. She had been doing this for two years before joining SPBD this year.

Glenda has requested a loan to buy Esky (a cooler box), fish, umbrellas and freight to transport the fish. She hopes to use her profit to improve her business and to meet her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy Esky (a cooler box), fish, umbrellas and freight to transport the fish

loans.name: Estar

texts.en: Estar, 25 years old, is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, she has run a small market where she buys vegetables from the farmer and resells them. Estar needs a loan to buy tables, chairs, lights, plastic bags, vegetables, umbrellas and other raw food items to assist her to run the business. She plans to use her profit to meet her family's weekly expenses and to improve her business. Estar joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, lights, plastic bags, vegetables, umbrellas and other raw food items

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in hand-crafted jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of gemstones and to hire more artisans for her workshop. Khun has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story: Khun's love for art is a life-long passion. "I was exposed to the traditional art and customs of Southeast Asia. My love for art is ingrained in my personality and in the details of my designs." "Thank you very much for the support. This microcredit will help me extend my creativity to the fullest." Use the link below to view Khun's hand-crafted jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6487

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of gemstones and to hire more artisans for her workshop

loans.name: Rogerio

texts.en: Rogerio is an artisan from Brazil who specializes in leather handbags. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather. Rogerio has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: "I was born in northeastern Brazil and moved to Rio de Janeiro at the end of the 1980s. At first, I worked as an assistant for an uncle who made leather purses, wallets and briefcases and I became a professional in leather crafting. In time, I resolved to go into business for myself. I acquired equipment and began to create my own line of purses and briefcases. I submitted my work in the leather art category and it was accepted. After awhile, I had enough clients to expand my small endeavor. I have always believed I could create designs that satisfy my client's taste, and have always kept up with fashion trends. I place all the love and dedication I possess into my craft, and I believe that today I am reaping the fruits of my efforts. My objective has always been to grow, be innovative and extend the scope of my products." "I'd like to send my heartfelt thanks to each of you for this very important support that you offer me." Use the link below to view Rogerio's leather handbags on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3908

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in wood carvings. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, sandpaper, stain, polish and beads. Anna has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story: Ghana's Anna says, "I got the opportunity to work as an art vendor and developed an interest in arts and crafts. I sketch the designs on paper, then work closely with skilled artisans as they do the carving. I love that there is no waste of wood. Every small piece of wood can be used to create small creatures. I have trained two people and provide jobs for ten artisans. My design work helps me pay for my children's education." "I am grateful to all of you who help to fund my loan. Without your support, I do not know what I could have done to grow my business." Use the link below to view Anna's wood carvings on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8067

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, sandpaper, stain, polish and beads

loans.name: Flory

texts.en: Flory, 51 years old, is married and has four children. For the past five years, she has owned a small canteen, selling a variety of food items. Flory has requested a loan to buy ice blocks, biscuits, rice, noodles, sugar and soap to run her canteen. She plans to use her profit to improve her canteen and to meet her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy ice blocks, biscuits, rice, noodles, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela, age 26, prepares and sells ice snacks to earn her living. She offers her goods for sale in her local neighborhood as well as at the market. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She lives with her husband in Honiara.

Angela is a new member of SPBD, and she has requested a loan in order to invest in her business by purchasing a cooler, an aluminum dish, containers, a bale of sugar, milk, flavorings, and colorings. 

She plans to use her increased profits to improve her business as well as to meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, an aluminum dish, containers, a bale of sugar, milk, flavorings, and colorings to use in the preparation and sale of ice snacks

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, age 32, sells strings of shells (known locally as "shell money") at the market to earn her living. She has been engaged in this activity for 10 years. She lives with her husband and their two children.

Cecilia has been a SPBD member since 2014. She has requested a loan in order to buy farakwasi (white shells), kurila (black shells), romu (red shells) and bits to invest into her business. 

Her goal is to use the expected profits to meet her family's daily expenses and eventually to provide them with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farakwasi (white shells), kurila (black shells), romu (red shells) and bits

loans.name: Masiala

texts.en:
Masiala, age 34, buys and sells fish at the local market to earn her living. She has been engaged in this work for two years. She lives with her husband and their three children.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014, and she has requested a loan in order to buy fish and an Esky cooler for her business. 

With her expected profit, she intends to expand her business so that she can better meet her family's ongoing expenses. Eventually, she would like to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and an Esky cooler

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, potatoes, meat, chicken and other supplies

loans.name: Nargul

texts.ru: Наргул 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом растят 2 детей. Наргул очень пунктуальная, ответственная и предприимчивая. Она умеет вести свое хозяйство и вкладывать деньги в нужное русло. На сегодняшний день Наргул занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Ежеквартальный доход составляет 45,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Наргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nargul is 38, married, and is raising two children with her spouse. Nargul is very punctual, responsible, and resourceful. She knows how to run her farm and invest money in the right areas. She currently raises livestock and plants crops and she has two cows. She earns 45,000 som (KGS) per quarter. In order to expand her farm, Narugul applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow and increase her herds. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana sells second-hand clothing items to earn her living. She has been engaged in this activity since 2011 and has gained many regular customers. She reports that her business has helped to make her independent, since she can responsibly support herself and her family through this enterprise. She is comfortable in her work and is happy that she can earn money every day from her business.

Ana and her husband have five children.

She requested a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to improve her business. She will use her loan funds to buy additional inventory items such as shorts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts, and long pants. 
 
Her eventual goal is to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items such as shorts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts, and long pants to offer for sale

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy, 65, lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has eight children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland. She primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural produce to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 2.50 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling.

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина замужняя женщина и мать в возрасте 35 лет. Ее муж, как и многие мужчины районов и сел оставил свою семью и уехал на заработки в заграницу, чтобы прокормить детей и жену. Парвина всеми домашними делами занимается одна. Парвина выращивает скотов и дома занимается животноводство. Сейчас денежные переводы сократились и ей необходимо увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности, чтобы покрыть расходы. Она намерена купить еще пару голов телят, откормить их и после продать с наценкой. У нее имеется все условия для такого бизнеса. Парвине не хватает денежных средств, и она надеется, что благодаря кредиту она осуществит свой план.
texts.en: Parvina is a married woman and a mother, aged 35. Her husband, like many men in this district and village, left his family to work abroad in order to feed his wife and children. Parvina does all of the household work by herself and raises livestock at home. She is receiving less money now and needs to increase her income to cover costs. She intends to buy another pair of calves, fatten them, and then sell them at a profit. She has everything she needs to run this kind of business. Parvina does not have enough money and she hopes that her plan will succeed thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to buy a pair of calves and expand her business

loans.name: Magidi

texts.en:
Magidi is a married man aged 31 years with one child who is young. He lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with his family and three children who are relatives. He operates a retail shop and supplements his family income with income from a saloon and agriculture. He works seven days a week, and each day he works for 14 hours.

He started his business in 2012 with the aim of getting money to increase family income. He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy fertilizers and herbicides for coffee plantation.

His clients are traders from surrounding towns, and his dream is to be the leading producer of coffee in his area, but his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital. With continuous financial boost, this will be history.

He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun, 32 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has only one little child. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland. He primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural produce to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, he has been in this type of business for ten years. On average, he is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

Currently, he would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of travelling.

He is thankful to all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth, 48 years old, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has two children. To make a living and support the family, he has been involved in the farming business since 1985. He grows rice and sells his agricultural produce to local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that he can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for his farm. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Kusayini

texts.en:
Kusayini is a married man aged 38 years with four children who are 10, 8, 6 and 2 years respectively. He lives in a rural area with his family, and three of his children still attend school. 

He deals in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He works six days a week, and each day he works for 10 hours.

He started his business in 2009 with the aim of getting money so that he can solve the family's financial problems. He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy fertilizers for coffee plantation.

His clients are traders from surrounding towns, and his dream is to build a commercial building in their trading center. His biggest challenge is lack of enough capital.

He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok, 50, lives in Kampong Cham Province. He is a lovely father of four children. To make a living, he has been involved in agri-business since 1980. He owns some farmland and grows rice. He sells the crops to local dealers and sometimes he sells directly to customers at the market. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 7.00 per day.

In this farming season, he would like to hire some people to clear his farmland in order to re-grow rice. Due to a shortage of money, he would like to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for hiring laborers.

He would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is taking a loan of $ 900.00 to improve her business.

She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, biscuits and body loosen (hair products). She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.

Celina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, biscuits and body loosen (hair products).

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is applying for a loan of $1500 to improve her business.

She runs a business in her house having opened a beauty salon shop. She makes a good income from her beauty salon and she wants to buy more needed items with the loan. She lives in town nearby the main road, so many people come to her beauty salon shop; she opens every day. She opened her business two years ago with her own working capital of $50.

loans.use: to buy hair oil and a hair cutting machine.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 26 years old and married with four children. She buys fish and sells them at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

She requested a loan to buy fish, an umbrella, bucket, BBQ plate, containers and a table to assist her in running the business. She hope to use her profit to expand her business and also meet her family's daily expenses.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013

loans.use: to buy fish, an umbrella, bucket, BBQ plate, containers and a table.

loans.name: Marlene Concepcion

texts.es:
Si  existe  alguien que  conozca  mejor la preparación  de exquisitos  nacatamales esa es Marlene.  Desde la edad doce años empezó a vender este producto junto a su madre, quien le enseñó  las técnicas necesarias para su elaboración. Al casarse,  decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, así fue  poco a poco, dándose a conocer en los alrededores de su comunidad, que la prefiere por la calidad y sazón inigualable. 
El objetivo de Marlene es ampliar sus ventas y dar a conocer su producto en  otras comunidades.  Ella trabaja por encargos y ofrece sus nacatamales  a muchos restaurantes que están situados cerca de su  humilde casa. Por lo tanto, optó  por solicitar un financiamiento  en KIVA-MiCrédito para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de los nacatamales y mantenerse estable con un mayor capital, de esa forma continuara creciendo y logrará mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar en un futuro.
texts.en:
If there is anyone that knows how to make exquisite nacatamales [stuffed banana leaves], it is Marlene. When she was twelve years old, she began selling nacatamales alongside her mother who taught her the necessary skills in making them. Then after getting married, she decided to start her own business with the help of her husband. And so it was that gradually she became known in her community, and her neighbours chose to buy from her because of the quality and taste of the food.

Marlene now wishes to expand her business into other communities. She takes orders and also sells the food in the many restaurants located near her simple home. Therefore she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva/MiCrédito to  and make her business more sustainable. In this way she will be able to continue growing her business and also make improvements to her house in the future.

loans.use: buy the ingredients for making nacatamales

loans.name: Sokla

texts.en:
Sokla, 34, comes from Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is a garment factory worker and earns, on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for three years.

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation.

She and her family are thankful to lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Kamsat

texts.en:
Kamsat, 52, is a married woman from Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has eight children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business. She grows rice and sells the crops to local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for around thirty years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as brick, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house for her children. Through this loan, she hopes her children can experience living in a comfortable house.

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house for her children.

loans.name: Evelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Evelio, es casado, vive con su esposa y una hija que tiene dos años de edad, entre él y su esposa se esfuerzan para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, su actividad económica es la de cultivar granos básicos para alimentar a su familia y para poder comercializar otra parte, trabaja de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, ya cuenta con 15 años de experiencia.
Invertirá en insecticidas, abono, herbicidas y semilla mejorada de granos básicos, será de ayuda para seguir trabajando en la agricultura, espera obtener una buena cosecha y tener mejores ventas.
Las aspiraciones de don Evelio son ampliar su vivienda y darles a sus hijos estudios superiores para que sean de utilidad en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Evelio is married and lives with his wife and a two-year-old daughter. Between him and his wife, they strive to meet the needs of their family. He earns a living cultivating basic grains to feed his family and to be able to sell a portion of it. He works from six in the morning to two in the afternoon, and has 15 years of experience.

He will invest in insecticides, fertilizers, herbicides and better basic grain seeds. It will help him to continue working in agriculture. He hopes to have a good harvest and to achieve better sales.

Don Evelio’s aspirations are to expand his home and to give their children a higher education so that they will be useful in the society.

loans.use: to invest in insecticides, fertilizers, herbicides and better basic grain seeds. It will help him to continue working in agriculture.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 26 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small fuel shed in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.
She requested a loan to buy diesel fuel, engine oil, brake fluid and a pressure pump to run the business. Annette plans to use her profit to improve her business as well as generate additional income to earn extra for her family's future. She has been a SPBD member since 2014.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, engine oil, brake fluid and a pressure pump.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 7 años de edad que se encuentran estudian. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 15 años se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de comida en  el mercado de su municipio, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con una fuente de ingresos que le permite sostener a su familia. Juan desea construir una habitación en su vivienda, ya que su familia es grande y siente que viven en hacinamiento, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
43-year old Juan lives in his own house with his wife and four children aged 14, 12, 10, and 7, all of whom attend school. Juan is a hardworking man who for fifteen years has earned his living selling food in the local market. He counts himself lucky to have a source of income that allows him to support his family.

Juan wishes to build another room on to his house as his family is large and the house feels overcrowded. For this reason he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a room as soon as possible. Then he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a room on to his house

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora ella es soltera y tiene 33 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leche, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people belong to the communal bank "Virgen Asunta", which is located in the Anta district, belonging to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco. 

One of the members is Sra. Dora. She is single and is 33 years old. She runs a restaurant where she makes different dishes such as oven-baked chicken, soups, and stir-fried meat. She works from 8 am to 6 pm, and has had her business for eight years. It is doing well. Dora is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The members whose photo appears at the side were excused from the main meeting for reasons of work. 

The members have businesses such as selling milk, selling vegetables, running a grocery store, and selling food.

Dora is grateful to those lenders who are helping her fulfill her dream and promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken for her restaurant

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 55, is a married man from Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has four children. He is a motorbike taxi driver. He is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been in this career for fifteen years.

Sokhorn is now applying a Kiva loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as brick, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house for his children. With this loan, he hopes his children can experience living in a comfortable house.

He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to build a new house for his children.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban, 60, resides in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland. She primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural produce to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling.

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Keang, 58, resides in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has five children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland. She primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a camera. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Top

texts.en: Top, 45, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support her family, she raises fish for selling. So far, she has been in this type of business for around five years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a sari-sari store owner from Ronda, Cebu. She is 30 years old, married and relies on her store for an income to help her husband who works in construction. Her store has existed for three years now. In it, she sell items such as canned goods, candies, cigarettes, biscuits, chips, soy sauce, cooking oil, detergent, bath soap, shampoo and coffee. She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies such as noodles, seasoning, toiletries and canned goods.

With a loan, Evelyn is confident that she can make a difference to her business and expand it.

In the future, she plans to buy more varieties of items that she does not already carry for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy noodles, seasonings, toiletries and canned goods.

loans.name: Ervina

texts.en:
Ervina is applying for a loan of $ 800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 26 years old.

Ervina runs a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, body loosen (hair product), eggs, cards, beer and soft drinks like fanta, sprite, and sagiko.. She makes good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Ervina lives in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, body loosen (hair product), eggs, cards, beer and soft drinks like fanta, sprite, and sagiko.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena lives in a town with her family.

Now, a $ 1,000 loan is offered to Filomena to improve her business. Filomena opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like books, water, body loosen (hair product), noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, eggs, shampoo and slippers. Filomena generates a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in this business.

loans.use: to buy books, water, body loosen (hair product), noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, eggs, shampoo and slippers.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom, 48, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of seven children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jose Ubaldo

texts.es: José de 24 años de edad es un joven emprendedor que vive en casa propia desde hace 6 años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con un lugar propio donde habitar. Él es un joven trabajador que se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado central, actividad que le permite sostener su hogar, y en el que pone todo su empeño. José desea construir un cuarto para la cocina, ya que actualmente no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto para la cocina en su vivienda, que le brinde mejores condiciones para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
José, age 24, is a young entrepreneur who has lived in his own house for six years.  He is happy to have his own place to live.  He is a hard-working young man who has been selling fruits and vegetables at the central market for three years.  This business activity allows him to support his household, and he puts all of his effort into it.

José wishes to build a room for the kitchen.  He does not now have a suitable place to prepare his food.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room for the kitchen at his house.  This will provide him with better conditions for preparing food.

loans.use: Para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto para la cocina en su vivienda.

loans.name: Rhany

texts.en: Rhany, 21 years old, is originally from Kampong Cham Province. She has one little child. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business where she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for around four years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average. To accelerate her farming operation, she would like to use a hand tractor to help her in the farming process. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a hand tractor. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can operate her farming better and faster. She is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Hrng is a 42-year-old man from a remote area of Kampong Cham province. He has five children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business. He grows rice and sells the crops to local dealers. He is able to make an income USD 2.50 per day, on average. So far, he has been involved in this type of business for nearly almost twenty years.

Heng would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate compared its general loans.

He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura has faced many challenges in the past few years, but she has not let them deter her happiness and success. As she puts it, “Everything started when I lost my job during the economic crisis in 2008. Due to the high rate of unemployment, finding another job was tough. Thus, I decided that investing my little savings account of $1,200 into opening my own business and in what I do best, was the best path to take.”

In December of 2008, she opened Alterations by Laura, a tailoring and sewing company. Before moving to the U.S. eleven years ago, Laura was a seamstress for over twenty years in Argentina. When she moved to the U.S., she worked various odd jobs to support herself. By starting her own company, she was able to return to her true passion of sewing.

With this loan, Laura plans to purchase new equipment to increase quality and to keep clothes organized. However, her dream is to be a wedding dress designer, and part of this loan will also be used to start designing and sewing wedding dresses. With a lot of hard work, she hopes to be a top wedding dress designer in the future and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase new garment equipment and expand her seamstress business to increase wedding dress design and production.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roman, a businessman, and has two children - one of which is in college and the other one in elementary level in school. Susan manages her household and has a business at home to augment their income and meet the daily household expenses and school needs of her children.

Susan makes and sells homemade pizza. Since the introduction of pizza in the Philippines, it has become one of the favorite snacks of the whole Filipino family. She has made her homemade pizza more flavorful and more Filipino in taste with her own seasonings.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 19,000 loan which she will use  the loan to buy a bigger oven and ingredients such as flour, ground pork, bacon, and native vegetables (such as eggplant, bell peppers, and mushrooms) needed to make her pizza. She is encouraged by the good sales of her pizza. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and a good return on her investment for it will greatly help in sending her children to school and fund their daily sustenance.

Susan dreams to have her own place and store to sell her pizza and attract more customers. She prays that both of her children will get a college degree to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/ lients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy flour, ground pork, bacon, veggies, and an oven toaster for making pizza.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old from the town of Ronda in Cebu. For three decades she has been raising hogs for a living to support her needs, such as food and household expenses. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed for her pigs. Lolita hopes that she can eventually produce healthy and fattened pigs to sell in four months time.

Lolita hopes to expand her business and make it more successful for her old age. The income will be for food consumption, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for fruits and vegetables to sell. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. Aside from her fruit/vegetable stand, she also earns from her small general store as she is shown on her photo. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, soda, and instant noodles and partly to pay for fruits and vegetables to sell. She is thanking God and you in advance for her good sales for the financial help that will be given for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education. 

Elena dreams of having a bigger general store and hopes to buy a vehicle to transport her fruits and vegetables. She aims to give her children the best education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits (mostly bananas) and grocery items to sell at her small store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
For years, Rebecca was acutely aware that organic or specialty foods were not accessible in many communities across the US. She had been a mortgage loan officer for seventeen years, and a mortgage company owner for nine years, but, as she puts it, “after spending 26 years in the corporate world, it was time to fulfill my dream and open my own store. There is nothing more rewarding than having your own business and helping others to achieve their dreams.”

Rebecca was born and raised in Chicago, IL, but with the help of her son and a friend, moved to Michigan to open her store. In 2014, she opened Union Pier General Store—a retail store selling organic, vegetarian, kosher, gluten-free, and vegan food, as well as local produce, recycled items, and items made specifically in Michigan. Her goal was to educate people on healthier eating and living, and make this sort of lifestyle accessible and affordable to a greater number of people, especially those with special diets.

Although her store has only been open for seven months, Rebecca is already receiving appreciation from customers in surrounding areas. The demand for her services is expanding, and she now must use a loan to develop her store’s services. The purpose of this loan is to purchase new storage equipment and also equipment to expand the available products at the store. She hopes to sell smoothies, snow cones, baked goods, and apparel in the coming years, as well as hire two new employees.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to hold community events to educate people on healthful eating. She wants to be able to create jobs in her community by employing people on a livable salary. Further down the line, she hopes to open more stores and write a cookbook.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, freezer, and new equipment to increase offered products at her health and sustainable goods store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 34-year-old woman from the community of Ronda in Cebu. Her partner is a trisikad (bicycle with a side car) driver who barely earns a living to support her and their one-year-old child.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her store such as shampoo, detergent, eggs, canned goods, chips and liquor.

Maribel hope to make her store building bigger and continue to expand to give her child a better future.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, detergent, eggs, canned goods, chips and liquor

loans.name: El Membrillal Group

texts.es: J. Wilman, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos con su esposa y reside en una aldea del municipio de San Marcos Colohete, Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura del cultivo de maíz, frijoles, maicillo y café. Tiene aproximadamente 13 años de experiencia en agricultura. El cultivo de café es su mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia, el cual vende ya lavado y secado en la misma zona. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener estable sus cultivos, actualmente solicita otro por 22,000 lempira para comprar abonos y aplicarle al cultivo de café. Su préstamo es en forma grupal que se llama El Membrillal, formado por 4 personas, dedicadas a la agricultura, y también viven en la misma comunidad. Solicitan un préstamo por 55,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos para aplicarle al cultivo de maíz y al café. En la foto esta J. Wilman a la izquierda, sigue Virgilio, María Inés y María Delcina a la derecha.
texts.en:
J. Wilman, 33, is married and has three children with his wife.  He lives in a community in the town of San Marcos Colohete, Lempira.

He has always worked in agriculture growing corn, beans, millet, and coffee.  He has about 13 years of experience in agriculture.  Growing coffee is his main source of income for his family.  He sells it in his same region, already cleaned and dried.

He has requested several loans to keep his crops stable.  Now he's asking for another loan, for 22,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy soil amendments to apply to his coffee crop.

This is a group loan for El Membrillal, made up of four people who work in agriculture and live in the same community.  They're requesting a loan for 55,000 lempiras to buy soil amendments for corn and coffee.  J. Wilman is at the left in the photo; next to him are Virgilio, María Inés, and, at the right, María Delcina.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments for his corn and coffee crops

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y también a la venta de yinas (sandalias) desde hace 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas yinas por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina, 60, lives in her own home with her two children.  She has earned a living for four years selling dairy products as well as sandals.  Her business is located in her home.  She's able to pay some of her household expenses with what she earns from her sales.

Cristina's requesting a loan to buy more sandals wholesale so she can continue making sales and earn more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sandals wholesale

loans.name: Jose Ruben Francisco

texts.es: Jose de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el es albañil y también trabaja elaborando ventanas, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando puertas y ventanas pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, balcones, hierro, etc. para que el y us esposa puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en:
José, 35, lives in his own home with his wife.  He's a bricklayer and he also works making windows.  With what he earns from his job he's able to pay for some of the household expenses.

José wants to improve his house, installing new doors and windows.  He doesn't have enough money to do this from what he earns at his job, however, so he's requesting a loan to buy metal sheets, balconies, rebar, etc.  That way he and his wife will live more securely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, balconies, rebar, etc.

loans.name: Chrep

texts.en:
Chrep, 50, lives in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is a mother of five children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling her crops to local dealers.  

Chrep has been a farmer for 25 years. She can make an income of $2 (US) a day, on average. To accelerate her farming process, she wants to buy horses to help carry the many heavy farming materials she uses. 

Because she has insufficient money to buy horses, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan through Hattha Kaksekar. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can accelerate her farming process. 

She is thankful to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy horses to accelerate her farming process

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de pan, desde hace varios años de manera ambulante por la diferentes colonias su esposa le ayuda en las ventas, inicio con una sola jaba vendiendo como las que muestra en la fotografía, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pan por mayor y para reparar la bicicleta que es donde anda vendiendo, y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio, age 53, lives in his own home with his wife. He is in the business of selling bread, which he does by traveling through the various neighborhoods. His wife helps him with his sales. He began a single crate, selling his goods as shown in the photo. With what he makes from his sales, he is managing to get ahead. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy more bread at wholesale and repair his bicycle, which is his main sales vehicle. With this help, he can continue working and earn more money.

loans.use: buy bread at wholesale and repair his bicycle

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace 9 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, etc. y mejorar el horno donde elabora el pan y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 39, lives in his own home with his wife.  For nine years, he has been in the business of making and selling bread. His business is located out of his home, and with what he earns from his business, he manages to meet several of his household expenses.

He is requesting this loan to buy flour, yeast, butter, and more and to improve his bread oven. That way, he can continue his work and increase his income.

loans.use: buy ingredients for bread and repair his oven

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
After working as a top bikini model for over ten years, Lorena decided to seek an different outlet for her creativity. After one year in the U.S., she started her own fashion design business. For four years, she has used the human body as her canvas, developing innovative, beautiful, and artistic creations. Lorena’s passion is her business. She loves being her own boss, creating designs, and providing excellent sale services. 

Lorena’s business helps her support her mother, as well as herself. Currently, Lorena has one assistant and a production workshop in Colombia, and is trying to expand company sales beyond the United States to include Colombia and other countries. This loan will provide capital to help bring out her new 2015 collection and purchase supplies like cloth and accessories

Her future goals for her business, Orlo Designs, are to be recognized in several countries, have her designs in top showrooms and boutiques, and have a large social media presence (Facebook, Instagram, etc). She hopes to augment her sales and improve marketing efforts and continue to produce beautiful and high quality clothing lines.

loans.use: to help bring out her new 2015 collection and purchase supplies like cloth and accessories

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 47, is married, has two children and is from Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing and selling rice to local dealers. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. She is able to make an income of $2 (US) per day, on average.  

Parts of her house deteriorated recently and they need to be fixed for the house to provide suitable living conditions for the household. Due to a lack of funds, Phalla has applied for a Kiva loan via Hattha Kaksekar to pay for her house renovation. 

She and her family will be thankful to lenders for helping them with this loan, intended to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Deppie Tinny

texts.en:
Deppie Tinny struggled with her weight and health for many years. However, her story is one not only of success, but also a story of a woman’s inspiring desire to help others. 

After succeeding in maintaining a healthy weight, Deppie Tinny realized that her experiences and lessons learned along the way to success were insights worth sharing. She wanted to lessen the challenges and mistakes made by other women in trying to improve their health. Therefore, she decided to start a small women’s healthcare business. 

Starting a women’s healthcare company is a daunting task, and Deppie Tinny displays foresight in her plans to progress in stages. Immediately, she wants to create a website where she shares tips, weight loss plans, and health advice. This loan will help kick start the business. She will use it to purchase a copier, fax machines, and scanner, new software and a computer. In the future, she plans to expand her company to include a professional counseling services and a medical diagnostic laboratory to provide health screening services for clients. Her long-term goal is to provide a much needed resource to people—especially young women—who cannot afford healthcare.

loans.use: to kickstart her health counseling company and purchase software, a computer, and other equipment

loans.name: Ponce

texts.en:
Ponce is the epitome of a driven, independent entrepreneur. Ever since he entered the workforce after high school, he has felt strongly about being self-employed. As he puts it, “I would rather be captain of my own rowboat than first mate on a luxury liner!” Originally from Georgia, he started his own courier business nine years ago in the Hartford, Connecticut area. Today, he employs ten people and continues to provide affordable, efficient delivery services in New England. 

With this loan, Ponce will be able to improve company advertising online. In the future, he hopes to increase his number of drivers to twenty, and expand the company so that his services are accessible from anywhere in the world. On a more personal level, he wants to build a company that gives him enough financial security to have a good quality of life and also time to pursue side hobbies.

Check out his website at http://www.courierservicehartford.com/

loans.use: to improve online advertising for his courier business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish buying a plot of land and start trenching it. She will also buy tubing to instal water. Later, she will continue the construction so that her children can enjoy this inheritance.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is thankful that she was previously granted a loan of 25,000 Philippine pessos, which she used to purchase various grocery items and other products for her general store. Through her earnings, she was able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a loan of 50,000 PHP, which she will use as her working capital to buy grocery items in quantity, such as canned goods, coffee, soda, instant noodles and toiletries, which she sells at retail prices. As well, with part of the loan, she will pay for things needed for her new food vending business. 

She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that she will receive. It will surely help her to send her children to school and fund their daily needs. 

Estella dreams of her business growing and hopes to acquire a vehicle. She aims to send her children to college and see them become professionals some day. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her general store and for things needed for her new food vending business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Florence est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Florence vit à Adidogomé pour exercer son activité de vente d’articles de mercerie. Ce commerce lui permet de venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire. Florence s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des fils à coudre et des rouleaux de doublure, Florence demande ce prêt pour acheter ses produits et augmenter son bénéfice pour aider ses enfants à s’épanouir
texts.en:
Aged 36, Florence is a married woman and the mother of four children. She lives in Adidogomé and has a business selling sewing notions. This trade allows her to help with her family's needs and make a good profit margin. 

Florence stocks up twice a month at a market. So as to order some spools of sewing thread and rolls of lining, Florence is requesting this loan to buy her merchandise and grow her profit so that she can help her children to flourish.

loans.use: to buy nine dozen spools of thread and four rolls of lining material

loans.name: Eugenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Eugenia de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y de mas ingredientes todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Eugenia, age 65, lives in her own home with her two grandchildren. She is in the business of making and selling pupusas, a traditional type of stuffed dumplings. She has twenty years of experience with her business, which is located near her home in an area that gets a lot of traffic. With what she earns from her sale, she manages to meet several of her household expenses. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy pork rinds, cream cheese, beans, rice, and other ingredients at wholesale. That way, she can continue her sales, which are her only source of income.

loans.use: buy pork rinds, cream cheese, beans, rice, and more at wholesale

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora has mastered swine production in Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and supports her husband in raising their family. 

Nora was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she was truly gratheful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. 

Just as she takes care of her swine production business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always apply for any financing that she may need. 

This loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos will be used to purchase bags of gestating feeds for her swine. Nora hopes and prays that her business will grow, because that will help her save enough for future emergencies. She wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestating feeds for her swine

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 40 years old. She is married with three children, who are two, five, and seven years old. For 10 years, she has been raising hogs to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy sacks of feed to support the feed requirement of her hogs and make them healthy to sell in the future. 

Rosemarie hopes to expand her business so she can help her husband, who drives a trisikad (a bicycle with a side car), to earn a living. In the future, she hopes to provide a prosperous life for her children through her businesses.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and is from Ronda, Cebu. She is married with two children, who are eight and 16 years old. While her husband works as a farmer, she has helped by operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. This has been on-going for fifteen years now.

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy chips, canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, and seasoning. She hopes to establish a bigger business for better sustainability.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like chips, canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, and seasoning

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 44-year-old married woman with three children. To earn a living, she started a sari-sari store business to help her husband pay for living expenses and be able to provide for her children's needs. It was a good business for the family because they earned a monthly income of PHP 3,000 a month.

She took a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store. As she increases her store inventory, she will get more sales.

Arlyn wants to improve her family's living condition with the proceeds from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Somina

texts.en:
Somina is a 21-year-old single student who is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in law, and is in his second year at a university in the city. His father is a carpenter and his mother is a teacher.

Because Somina is short of finances to cover his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. His dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary, so that he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year

loans.name: Yanci Estefani

texts.es: Yanci de 20 años de edad es una joven trabajadora que vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad que es a alegría de su hogar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante, por lo que desde hace varios años se gana la vida como cocinera de un restaurante cercano, lo que le permite apoyar a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar, ya que él se dedica a la sastrería. Yanci desea construir su vivienda, ya que actualmente vive en la casa d su madre, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir su vivienda de lámina.
texts.en:
Yanci, age 20, is a hard-working young woman who lives with her partner and their one-year-old child, who is the joy of their home. She is an enterprising woman who strives every day to get ahead. For several years now, she has earned a living working at a cook at a nearby restaurant, which lets her support her husband, who works as a tailor, in the household expenses.

Yanci wants to build a home as they currently live with her mother. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to help buy sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire so that she can build a home from sheet metal.

loans.use: build her home from sheet metal

loans.name: Chanheng

texts.en:
Chanheng, 51, lives in a small community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is the father of five children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice, and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he is has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 10.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan, granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sinai

texts.en:
Sinai, 34, lives in a small community of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of one little child. To make a living and support her family, she raises cows for sale. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan, granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Yoirn

texts.en:
Yoirn, 47, lives in a small community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He is the father of two children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice, and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 8.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy, 46, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of rice farmland, which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan, granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase school/office supplies to sell at her store. Her earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. Aside from school supplies store, she also has a small general store where she appears on her photo. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, canned goods, and toiletries which she sells at retail. Part of the loan she will use to add school/office supplies to her inventory. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Merlina dreams of having a bigger general store and school supplies store someday. She wants her children to have a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and school/office supplies to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Robin

texts.en:
Robin makes a good living with every quarter of his farm in Oqoquieta, in the Philippines. This is his means of supporting his family. Robin has been able to send all his children to school until they graduated and secured their own jobs. Out of the money he has saved, Robin purchased a 2-hectare plot. 

Now he wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts and bananas of a good variety so he can increase his farm's yield. However, Robin is in need of working capital. 

He presented his project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow his land and plant seedlings. Robin has high hopes that his farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plow his land and plant seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her husband's rickshaw's engine and body.

loans.name: Safia Bibi

texts.en:
Safia Bibi is a 50-year-old woman, living with her 10 children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Safia Bibi’s son drives an auto rickshaw. He pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. Safia Bibi's son is part of an ultra poor family, and he has been feeding his children, but now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Safia Bibi has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, Safia Bibi has requested a loan so that her son can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that her son will be able to generate more income because he will not have to pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son in purchasing a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns a small canteen in her community, selling varieties of food items to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

She requested a loan to buy cartons of noodles, baled rice, baled sugar, cartons of biscuits, and cartons of canned food. 

She hopes to use her profit to improve her business and provide her family's daily demands. She joined SPBD in 2015.
