loans.use: to buy cartons of noodles, baled rice, baled sugar, cartons of biscuits, and cartons of canned food.

loans.name: Jalal Group

texts.en:
Randa is the featured borrower of Jalal Group, which consists of four hardworking women who put so much effort into developing their living, businesses and families' needs.

Randa is a 55-year-old divorced mother of one child who has been working in the Mouneh business and baking Sajj bread for 10 years now to provide her child with the necessary living needs after the divorce. Randa is specialized in preparing tasty jams, pickles, Kishek, and many other well-known Mouneh items that are highly requested by her customers. Her house is her base for work; she has to stay to take care of her child and at the same time, she has to improve and develop a business that can support them to benefit from a better living.

Her business demands a lot of effort to search for the best products to work with, and the process itself needs a lot of effort to be done, but Randa is thankful that she's still capable of doing it by herself. Her income is good enough to cover their living needs, but not enough to expand her working sector. Thus, for this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary raw materials to develop her business, especially with the current season's products to be conserved for the winter and autumn seasons.

Randa is the second lady from the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Rabab is the first from the left, Rihab is the second from the right, while Roula is the first lady at the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: to buy the necessary raw materials to develop her business.

loans.name: Susana Pilar

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 18, 11 y 7 años, y su negocio venta de ropa de segunda mano. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, comprensiva, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Sur’ situada a orillas del río Piraí, caracterizada por crecimiento demográfico que se encuentra entre los más rápidos de América del Sur, de clima cálido subtropical donde los meses de mayor precipitación pluvial son enero y febrero. El mes más caliente es enero, y el mes más frío es julio.
Susana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa infantil de segunda mano, ella se encarga de comprar aquella ropa que los niños se pusieron pocas veces o incluso se quedó nueva con etiqueta, y la vende a precios muy asequibles entre un 50% y un 70% menos del precio original de compra. Su trabajo inicia con la selección de buena ropa para garantizar que la ropa está en perfecto estado. Cada prenda que selecciona pasa por un exigente proceso de aceptación, asegurando así que sus prendas estén como nuevas; “La ropa de segunda mano que selecciono; vestidos de fiesta, abrigos y complementos, se califica prenda a prenda y se paga en el momento y al contado…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende ropa de calidad y los clientes son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en el negocio. Su sueño es ser una vendedora mayorista, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa infantil por mayor para aumentar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Susana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa infantil de segunda mano por mayor para convertirse en una vendedora mayorista.
texts.en:
Susana, age 43, is the single mother of three children, aged 18, 11, and 7 years. She runs a business selling secondhand clothing.  She's a good mother: enterprising, patient, understanding, responsible, and very hard-working. She runs her business in the South region, along the banks of the River Piraí, an area that's experiencing some of the most rapid growth in South America. It's a warm, subtropical zone where the rainiest months are January and February. The hottest month is January and the coldest month is July.

Susana is brown-skinned and has long, black hair that she wears tied back. She has brown eyes, a short stature, and slim complexion. Her first language is Guaraní, which she speaks among family, and she speaks Spanish with society at large and for her business. She shares her life with her children, who are in school. They live in their own home, made from brick and cement, which has water, electricity, and sewer services.

Her business is selling secondhand children's clothing. She buys clothing that is either gently used or sometimes still new with the tag on, then sells it at accessible prices, between 50%-70% off the original price. Her work begins by choosing good clothing and making sure it's in perfect shape. Each selection must pass a demanding acceptance process, assuring that the garments are still like new. "The secondhand clothing I choose - party dresses, coats and accessories. Each item is graded a piece at a time and is paid for either at the time or on credit," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she sells high quality clothing and steady customers. The disadvantage is a lack of capital to invest in her business. Her goal is to become a wholesale merchant.  She wants to buy children's clothing at wholesale to increase her sales and expand her business. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the twelve years that she's been running her business.

It's for these reasons that Susana is requesting a loan: to buy secondhand children's clothing at wholesale to become a wholesale vendor.

loans.use: buy secondhand infant's clothing at wholesale to become a wholesale vendor

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin sells gasoline, rice and firewood for a living in his native Trinidad, Bohol. He is 32 years old and married with four children ages 1, 6, 12 and 14. Benjamin is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy rice and gasoline. 

Benjamin dreams of making his business a success and sending his children to school so they will have a brighter future. His income will go toward tuition fees and family consumption.

loans.use: to buy rice and gasoline

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and married with five children. The family lives in Lazi, Siquijor, in the Philippines. Vilma has rented a space in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, which enables her to support the needs of her big family.

Since she wants to generate more income, Vilma joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance. She purchases fish in bulk for resale at the market. She has now applied for a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public markets of nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a business dying materials (Lava lava) in her community. She has three years of experience in this business. Josephine has requested a loan to buy soft materials, coloring dyes, stencils and dishes to assist her in running the business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and meet her family's daily expense. She joined SPBDM in 2015.

loans.use: to buy soft materials, coloring dyes, stencils and dishes.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 41 years old and married. The family lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor. For a living, Lilibeth has a snack vending business. As a mother, she believes education is the key to succeed in life. Lilibeth hopes to provide for her family's needs, especially her children's education. With the loan of 10,000 PHP she will be able to pay for the tuition and graduation costs of her daughter. She wants all her children to finish their studies and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition and graduation costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. 

Recently, Felisa requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. 

Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pig for commercial sale and plans to working on swine production for her business expansion. 

Someday Felisa hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income

loans.name: Francisca Sales

texts.es: Su nombre es Francisca Sales y vive en el distrito de Huanca, del departamento de Arequipa. Ella vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos que se encuentran en época escolar. Francisca se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y vende su carne como carne orgánica, dado que su ganado es alimentado con forraje natural y orgánico, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar unas vacas con meses de nacidos y su debida alimentación orgánica, dado que la carne de ganado orgánico se vende a un precio mas elevado y le genera mas ingresos. Aunque la carne orgánica no es muy comercializada por su localidad, Francisca igual apostara por la carne orgánica, dado que tiene clientes frecuentes que consumen carne orgánica. Francisca espera que sus hijos tengan una buena alimentación, aunque no tengan cantidad de comida, ella espera darles siempre alimentos de calidad y en el futuro espera poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación y que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisca Sales lives in the district of Huanca in the department of Arequipa. She lives with her partner and 4 children who are in school. Francisca makes a living raising beef cattle. She sells her meat as organic beef, since she nourishes her cattle with natural and organic feed.

She is requesting a loan to buy some cows that are a few months old as well as organic feed for them. Since the meat of organic cattle is sold at a higher price, she earns a greater income. Although organic beef is not highly commercialized in her community, Francisca still sells organic meat because she has regular customers who consume organic beef. 

Francisca hopes that her children will have a good diet. Even though they will not have a great quantity of food, she hopes to give them quality food always. In the future, she hopes to be able to give her children a good education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy organic beef cattle.

loans.name: Nouhad

texts.en:
Nouhad is a 40-year-old married mother of three. Eight years ago she started her own home products sales shop, to support her husband in covering their family's living needs and education expenses.

Nouhad is a hardworking woman who puts so much effort to develop her business and expand it, since her husband is abroad seeking a better income business to support his family. She had to and still takes the place of both the hardworking father and the caring mother, which is exhausting for a lady to do, but she has proven that she is capable of handling both responsibilities at the same time.

Today, since Nouhad is working hard to develop her business, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released spring and summer bed shields and blankets, in addition to requested home products that will definitely increase her sales since they are highly requested by her customers.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business in a well managed way to make sure she can provide her family with a better living.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released spring and summer bed shields and blankets, in addition to requested home products.

loans.name: Deorie

texts.en:
Deorie is 34 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables, in the Philippines. Deorie requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase an additional variety of seeds for her farm.

Deorie has been farming vegetable for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety of seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem is a 31-year-old married man from Gaza City. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. During the last conflict in Gaza, his home was destroyed completely. Hatem and his wife are living now in a rental house.

Hatem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some construction supplies to rebuild his home. This loan will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses that he has.

Hatem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some construction supplies to rebuild his home.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 28 años, madre de 2 hijos menores, y su negocio es la venta de peces y accesorios para peceras.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, sensible, responsable y trabajadora. 
Su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de El Retiro; un área estratégica porque tiene un alto flujo comercial; es una vitrina de la producción de la pequeña y mediana empresa, la zona es una muestra del panorama típico comercial e industrial de la ciudad. 

Su vida la comparte con su esposo.

Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para abrir un almacén, ella desea realizar la compra de peces ornamentales y peceras con buena adecuacion al por mayor con el préstamo solicitado, para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old, a mother of two young children and has a business selling fish and accessories for aquariums. She is enterprising, independent, generous, sensible, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located in the municipality of El Retiro; a strategic area because it has a high commercial flow, it showcases production of small and medium enterprises. The area is a sample of the typical commercial and industrial panorama of the city.

She shares her life with her husband and her dream is to increase her income to open up a warehouse. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase ornamental fish and efficient aquariums, to offer a larger variety to her clients and increase her sales.

loans.use: purchase ornamental fish and efficient aquariums

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 40-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married has four dependents age 11 to 16.  Marilyn has been engaged in hog raising for six years now. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy piglets and feed.

Once her needs for these are taken cared of, Marilyn will be able to concentrate on her efforts to manage her piggery well for a better return of her investment.  Marilyn plans to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 48-years-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of five sons. Adel works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. During the last bombing of Gaza, his home was destroyed completely. Adel and his family are living now in a rental house.
 
Adel took a loan from FATEN to help him to buy construction supplies to rebuild his home. This loan will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.  
 
Adel appears in the photo .

loans.use: buy materials to rebuild his home

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 41-year-old married mother of two children who started a clothes selling business eighteen years ago to support her husband in their family's living.

Sanaa is a hard-working woman, well known in her region with her special products and encouraging prices. Her business is going on just fine, but not enough to support her family members to start their own businesses.  hus, for this reason, and since Sanaa is working hard to open another branch in the future, she though of starting a business for her son, so that he can be a responsible business man and prove that he can run his own business. This loan, which is acquired from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be the first step forward towards her son starting his own career business. She hopes that she can succeed in supporting her son in managing his own shop properly.

loans.use: start a business for her son

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is thankful that she was granted a 10000 PHP loan which she used to buy recyclable materials to sell to foundries. Her earnings helped cover her family's daily living expenses. Aside from her recycling shop she is also a tricycle operator.

Ignacia would now like to apply for a 20000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to pay for recyclable metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials which she will sell to foundries and the likes. Her income from her recycling shop helps sustain her family's daily personal and household needs. She is encouraged by the good sales and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ignacia dreams to increase her business and have a bigger recycling shop. She aims to save for her old age and prays for good health and long life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: buy scrap materials

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 61  years old. She is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and farms rice to earn a living with her husband. She has been growing rice for 16 years now. Her husband also helps in managing their farm. 

Nida is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to expand her business. She will utilize her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to help in maintaining healthy crops. Her income will allow her to save and provide a healthy diet for her and her husband.  In the future, she hope to make her farm bigger and more sustainable.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Marilyn has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fishing net

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Eveline works hard to support her family. She has a concrete block making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish.  

Eveline is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase sand, gravel and cement, and to pay for laborers salaries for her blocks business.

Eveline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy for concrete materials & pay for labor

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a man of the fields.  He works on from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening. His business is agriculture, which he learned from his father. He is a hardworking man and aggressive with the principle of truth on his lips. He is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry, and some “side hustles” he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. 

Dairy farming in Kenya has seen an upsurge in growth and milk prices in the recent past have skyrocketed. This has translated to increased earnings for farmers. Leonard, being a very hardworking and visionary farmer, wants to take advantage of the ready market. That is why he is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a good-quality breed of dairy cow. Leonard has already decided which dairy breed he requires, and because of his immense knowledge on preparing hay, his cows will have plenty of food and will produce more milk. Leonard projects that the cow he acquires through this  loan will be producing more than 10 liters a day. Because there is a ready market for milk, he does not worry too much about competition, and marketing the milk will not be a challenge. He will be selling it directly to the market as well as to big dairy-processing firms, which will result in increased earnings. Additionally, Leonard has planned that instead of selling the milk in its raw form, he will be packaging the milk. This will also improve his income. Profits from selling milk will enable Leonard to be very successful. He also plans that with his accumulated profits, he will be able to construct a biogas digester soon to produce energy that he will use in cooking and other domestic chores.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en: Fouzia is a 50-year-old mother of two children.  She is living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a green grocer by profession and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her son offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. Therefore, Fouzia, his mother, has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy excess seasonal vegetables to sell. Fouzia says thank to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy vegetables for her son's shop

loans.name: Sylphanus

texts.en:
Sylphanus is an ambitious man and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of horticulture products. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. 

Sylphanus is a 39-year-old father of two who lives in the Thika area, which is located in the central province of Kenya. He has farmed for ten years and earns an honest and decent income. Sylphanus does both crops and dairy farming, and also has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Sylphanus. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. 

Sylphanus seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. Sylphanus and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. Sylphanus is disciplined regarding finances, and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income and  obtain a stable future for his family.

loans.use: venture into other areas of farming

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one son and three daughters. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. During the last valance on Gaza, his home was destroyed completely, and also he has some injuries on his legs. Mohammad and his family are living now in a rental house. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some construction supplies to rebuild his home. This loan will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some construction supplies to rebuild his home.

loans.name: Rossel

texts.en:
Rossel is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 34 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community, which she has done for 11 years. She sells basic household commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell, like cigarettes, shampoo, soap, biscuits, liquor, beverages, candies, sardines and detergent. 

These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, Rossel is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous. She will use her profits for the school fees of her ten year old daughter.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, shampoo, soap, biscuits, liquor, beverages, candies, sardines and detergent.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net. Hermenia has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Hermenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle business.

Letecia has been in this business for three years. She also earns more income from buying and selling coconuts. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mophat

texts.en:
Working on the land is one of the hardest jobs because of the great effort it takes to make progress.  Mophat, however, is a man who never gives up despite the weather or situations that happen. He always manages to meet the requirements of his family. He gets up very early in the morning to go to his farm where he works. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife. They have been blessed with five children. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 12 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business to supplement the meager income they earn. From Kiva lenders, Mophat is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to grow his horticulture business. (Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.) 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Mophat access to a loan facility that will help him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With this loan, Mophat’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Help him out!

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Abdel Lateef

texts.en:
Abdel Lateef is a 37-year-old, married man from Dier El Balah city. He is a father for two sons and one daughter. Abdel works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. During the last valance on Gaza, his home was destroyed completely. Abdel and his family are living now in a rental house.

Abdel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some construction supplies to rebuild his home. This loan will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has. Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some construction supplies to rebuild his home.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old single man, who has been working in car sales since 2012, and is working hard to develop it so that one day he can have his own car sales showroom in the future.

Since this business does not provide a based monthly or daily income, he continued in his old job as an accountant, until he reaches a good level of experience and capital in the car selling business.

Ali is working on increasing his business capital, but his acquired income isn't enough to cover his living needs and develop his business.

Thus, for this reason he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car to trade with and increase his business capital. He hopes that one day he can have his own showroom and develop his business properly.

loans.use: To buy a car to trade with and increase his business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some construction supplies to rebuild his home.

loans.name: Los Tajibo Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 17, 9 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, de buen carácter, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ un área rural ubicada al este de la ciudad, que se caracteriza por sus comidas tradicionales y por la elaboración de jalea y melao (derivados de la caña de azúcar), como también por su panadería tradicional de maíz y yuca, como; el sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapés y bizcochos, sus pobladores son herederos especialistas en artesanía; especialmente de cerámicas, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Francisca es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado como cola de caballo, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la tercera de izquierda a derecha, viste blusa celeste y pantalón jean celeste). Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su impulso por mejorar sus ingresos la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de bisutería para niñas, venta de verduras, venta de jugos, venta de papa, panadería, venta de juguetes, comercio de telas y pastelería, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte “taitetú” frito), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros., actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo en un cuarto en su domicilio habilitado como cocina, en las afueras de su casa; mesas y sillas y un par de sombrillas para que los clientes puedan comer sentados y cubiertos del sol. “cocino desde niña, pero mi negocio es nuevo y necesito un apoyo para mejorarlo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida se vende diariamente, la desventaja es que no cuenta con mobiliario suficiente para atender la demanda. Su sueño es tener un restaurante muy conocido, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor número de clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida y atender a mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is 35 years old, married and has 3 children of 17, 9 and 7 years of age. Her business is the sale of traditional food. She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, of good-natured, responsible and hardworking. Her business is in the town of Cotoca, a rural area located east of the city, characterized by their traditional meals and making jelly and syrup (derived from sugar cane), as well as by their traditional corn and cassava bakery items such as: sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapes and biscuits. Its people are heirs specializing in crafts, especially ceramics; they enjoy a warm tropical climate and a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Francisca is of dark complexion, long black hair, which she ties into a pony tail, brown eyes, short, of medium physique, her mother tongue is Guarani, which is spoken in the area, and also speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business (She is the third person from left to right, wearing a blue blouse and jeans). She shares her life with her husband, who works as a driver and with her children, who attend school. They live in their own home, built of brink and cement, has a tin roof, electricity and well-water.

Her drive to improve their income motivated her to form a business group with members in different enterprises, to request loans to expand their own activities, such as selling jewelry for girls, vegetable sales, juice sales, potato sales, bakery, toy sales, trading of fabrics and pastry baking.

Her business of selling traditional food such as: Majadito jerky (dried meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), chicharron taitetu (fried wild jungle pig meat), peanut soup, pork belly sauce (pork belly, onions, tomato and rice) and others, which she sells Monday to Sunday in a room on her property which has been transformed into a kitchen, right outside her house. Tables, chairs and a couple of umbrellas for customers to eat covered from the sun.

 “I cook since I was a child, but my business is new and I need support to improve it…” she says. The advantage of her business is that the food sell out daily. The disadvantage is that she does not have enough furniture to meet her demand. Her dream is to have a well-known restaurant. She wants to buy furniture to serve to a larger number of clients.

This is the second series of loans with this institution in the year she has been conducting this business independently. It is for these reasons that Francisca is requesting a loan for the purchase tables and chairs to sell her food and serve a larger number of clients.

loans.use: purchase tables and chairs to sell her food and serve a larger number of clients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 53 years old, married, and has three children ages 14, 16, and 19.  She is from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been farming rice for 11 years now. Victoria is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and seedlings for the farm. As Filipinos consume rice in a daily basis, the demand for the crop is very high. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina thought it was good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Marcelina has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently she requested a loan to purchase bags of feed for her growing hogs. 

Marcelina wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house, and to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed for her growing hogs

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is thankful that she was granted an 8,000 PHP loan which she used to buy scrap cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her sewing business. Through her earnings, she has been able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

Now, Joan would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more fabrics, scrap cloth, thread, and other materials needed for making doormats and rags. Doormats and rags are in demand for housekeeping and cleaning since they are changed constantly to ensure a bacteria free rug. 

Joan thanks God and you in advance for the financial help. She is also thankful for a good return on her business, since this is a big help with both her family's daily sustenance and her child's school needs.

Joan hopes to maintain and grow her doormat and rag-making business. Her child is attending elementary school, and Joan wants her to be able to earn her high school and college educations, which will allow her child better opportunities in the future. 

Joan faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her doormat and rag-making business.

loans.name: Omnigloria

texts.en:
Omnigloria earns through retailing various sea food like fish, shells, and seaweed. 

She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for more fish, shells, and seaweed to sell. 

She wishes nothing more than to have a happy and better life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for more fish, shells and seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Elemia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elemia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from house for rent.  Elemia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc., for her restaurant business.

Elemia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rubhee

texts.en:
Rubhee is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rubhee is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Rubhee has been raising pig for six years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old. He is married with five children aged between 1 and 12 years, and three of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 15 years, while his wife is a businesswoman.  

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Tete Ansanm Nap Vanse

texts.en:
Mecene is trained on detergent manufacturing. He buys and sells beauty products to 22 beauty salons and 7 barbers. Last year, his profits were around $1,040. He hopes to double it this year. 

Mecene’s marketing strategy relies on his social involvement and the assistance he is used to bring to elderly people in the community. His co-workers are motivated to keep his vision going. Marie Philomene(middle) and Brutus(right) accepted to be pictured with him. 

Mecene is 56 years old now. He would like to find a soft loan to satisfy his growing clientele while preparing for his future.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies to retail to customers

loans.name: Bel Mwayen

texts.en:
Charmere is the leader of BM whose main activity is providing small retailers with clothes.She is looking for a loan to seize a commercial opportunity to satisfy her high demand. 

That is the first time she is going to be connected to a microfinance institution. However, she had ventured many loans before inside a mutual solidarity group. She has been doing this activity for four years. 

Charmere has one child whose school fees are paid by her. This loan will serve as an additional capital. The expansion of Charmere's business will participate in empowering 26 women located in rural areas. Charmere in placed on the right in the picture. Louis is a co-worker( left) and Dejuste also works as part timer ( middle).

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothes to sell to customers

loans.name: Union De Sapotille

texts.en:
Union de Sapotille is the business name led by Yvenel. Thirty small retailers buy cornmeal from there on a monthly basis. Yvenel, aged 35, has been married for five years.

As Yvenel is promoting corn production, he is registering more and more customers. Today, Yvenel is looking for funds to supply more corn. That’s why he turned to Zafen to find a soft loan. 

The development of his activity projects a net profit of about 25%. Besides, 10% of it will be used to take local initiatives such as support old people or pay school tuition for unfortunate kids. in the picture, Yvenel is in the middle. Christian, a co-worker, is on his left and James, another co-worker, is on this right.

loans.use: To purchase 23 sacks of cornmeal to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, grills, coal and spices for her son's business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 56 years old, a widow with six children. She works very hard to earn a living.

Fe runs a general store in Trinidad, Bohol, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through CEVI to purchase additional stock to sell like rice, soft drinks, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, detergent and biscuits.

Fe has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, detergent and biscuits

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.ru: Садаф серьезный и ответственный человек. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Муж занимается земледелием.  Садаф 16 лет назад решила освоить деятельность родителей и идти по их стопам. В течение 16 лет Садаф постоянно сажает урожай. В этом году она хочет сажать огурцы. И активно готовиться к посеву. Садаф на заемные деньги хотела купить семян огурцы и минеральные удобрения. У нее не получилась собрать достаточную сумму денег для приобретения средств для посева и у нее вся надежда остается на кредит.
texts.en: Sadaf is a serious and responsible person.  She is 36 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Sixteen years ago, Sadaf decided to continue her parents' activity and follow in their footsteps.  So for the past 16 years she has been constantly cultivating her land.  This year, she wants to plant cucumbers and she is actively getting ready for the planting season.  She is using her loan to buy cucumber seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She was not able to gather enough money to purchase what she needed to start planting, so this loan is her only hope.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a bathroom and a water storage basin in his home.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is a wife, and she is a mother to children who are mostly grown. 

Vitaliana is engaged in a food vending business in her hometown of San Miguel, Bohol. She usually cooks sweet snack foods made of sticky rice. 

Vitaliana is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy sticky rice, coffee creamer, sugar, and coconut. She will also pay the tuition for her daughter who is about to graduate from college. 

In the future, Vitaliana plans to expand her business to make it even more successful.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice, coffee creamer, sugar, coconut, and pay her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is married with four children, and the family lives in Banban, Siquijor, in the Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family. She has always been known to provide the best for them. Jessie is earning a living by making snacks that she sells on consignment in shops and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 5,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her husband, Jessie smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Janice Fe

texts.en: Janice Fe thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Janice Fe has maintained her membership in good standing without a record of default. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale. Janice Fe wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house and to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Retailing helps Nellie's family survive. She retails charcoal and brings in a meager income of Php 4,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers.  Nellie plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. Nellie smiles at the think of her family with decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is from Siquijor in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. She makes a point of having good land preparation to ensure maximum yield and a good income. 

Lerma recently required a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to purchase land and pay for seedbed preparation and the planting of more vegetable seedlings on her land. 

Lerma wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply vegetables to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase land and pay for seedbed preparation and the planting of more vegetable seedlings on her land.

loans.name: Marygrace

texts.en: Marygrace has always dreamed of managing her own business to support her three children. She used her loan to buy additional inventories to meet customers' demands and be able to offer them more products. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profit and from it she can provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories to meet customers' demands and be able to offer them more products

loans.name: Jenevib

texts.en: Jenevib is driven by the passion of selling. At the age of 45, she has chosen to live as a single woman in Tudela, Philipiines. She runs a store to provide for her needs. Every day she patiently tends her store until 10:00 in the evening. Jenevib wants to expand her business; she recently applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where she became a member in order to access insurance and financial assistance. Now she has borrowed PHP 5,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and to extend help to her nephews and nieces in their college education.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Janita

texts.en: Janita has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated their agricultural land in Lazi, in the Philippines, and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations and buy fertilizer. This will ensure that the land is ready for planting. Janita knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Janita hopes to improve and expand her farming activities to benefit her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, 37 years old, is married and a resident of Simacolong, Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold in the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In May 2013 both Arlene and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to take a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy her fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Ronelyn has been in this business for 2 years. She also earns additional income from fish vending.

Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with help from the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: This is Kenneth, a farmer from Kericho who is passionate about dairy farming. He supports his family through the income he gets from selling his milk to the co-operatives around his village. He grows the feeds for his cow from his farm and allows them to go free range on his farm. He wants to teach the youth around his village that they don't need to have formal employment to feed their family but they can do farming successfully. He desires to increase his milk yield and with a Kiva loan he will be able to buy another cow.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Rocio

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer trabajadora, organizada y perseverante, dedicada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. 

Desde hace 1 año es comerciante independiente, tiene una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días durante 12 horas cuenta con la ventaja de no tener mucha competencia, por lo que ya es reconocido por los diferentes ciudadanos que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando elementos como barnices, artículos de uso personal y de miscelánea, esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. 

Martha manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is a hardworking woman, organized and persevering, dedicated to her family and passionate about her work.
For about a year now, she has been an independent trader, has a shop located in the center of the city, where she works every day for 12 hours and has the advantage of not having much competition, due to this, she is recognized by different townspeople, who have already become her main clients.

With the support the loan provides, she will strengthen her inventory, purchasing items such as nail polishes, personal-use type items and general store stock items, which will allow her to have a larger variety available to offer her clients and increase her sales.

Martha says her greatest wish is to continue strengthening and growing her business, which will ensure greater profitability and thus have the financial ability to acquire he own house, in which to enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: strengthen her inventory, by purchasing items such as nail polishes, personal-use type items and general store stock items

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella monto un café internet desde hace varios años y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Ella tiene 21 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos elementos de papelería para surtir un poco sus vitrinas y exhibidores. Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman with good ideas and a creative mind.  She is always looking to find work to increase her family's income.

She started an internet cafe a few years ago and also sells stationery items in the same space.  She is 21 years old and is ready to face all of the challenges that life has in store for her.

She is requesting a loan to purchase stationery items to stock her display cases.  With this money, she will be able to invest in her business and attract more customers, which will have a positive impact.

Her dream is to have a large internet cafe that earns a good income and provides employment for others.

loans.use: to purchase stationery items to stock her display cases.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. Около 9 лет назад в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. У Чолпон в хозяйстве есть 10 коров, 30 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 26,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует использовать для развития своего дела.
texts.en: Cholpon is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education.  About nine years ago she became involved in agriculture as a way to provide an additional source of income for her family.  She now has 10 cows and 30 sheep on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of 26,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 115,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Janet is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 20 años, soltero, tiene un hijo, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas.
Él es buen padre, constante, emprendedora, paciente, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por sus suelos, que son de arenas finas y arenas limosas, de clima cálido subtropical, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Luis es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta con su hijo que es un bebé, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas como; el cuñapé (a base de harina de arroz con queso), el sonso (yuca con queso a la parrilla), el pan de arroz (pan a base de arroz y leche), empanadas de maíz (a base de harina de maíz con queso) y otros…, que forman parte de  los tradicionales “horneados” de la gastronomía,  acompañado con un té o café, ayudan a combatir las cálidas tardes del lugar. “la venta a crecido bastante desde que inicié, nunca falta quién desea comer un cuñapé con un café caliente, especialmente en invierno…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los horneados tradicionales son muy populares y se venden continuamente, la desventaja es que debe caminar largas distancias para vender sus horneados. Su sueño es tener su tienda propia, él desea ampliar su negocio mediante el alquiler de un kiosco dónde pueda ofrecer el servicio de té y café. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para alquilar un kiosco para ofrecer el servicio de té y café acompañado con horneados tradicionales para pagar los gastos de su bebé.
texts.en:
Luís is a 20 year old man, single, with a child. He sells empanadas. He is a good father. He is reliable, enterprising, patient, energetic, responsible and hard-working.

He has an ambulatory business in the southern district of the city. This is an area characterized by its fine and silty soil. The climate is temperate and sub-tropical, and the temperature varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade. 

Luís is dark-skinned with short black hair, brown eyes, short stature and a robust build. His native tongue is Guaraní which he speaks at home. He speaks Spanish in the general culture and in his business.

He enjoys life with his baby son. They live in a room that belongs to his family. It is built of brick and cement, with a corrugated metal roof. It has potable water, electricity and sewage.

His business is selling empanadas such as “cuñapé” (made from rice flour and cheese), the “sonso” (yucca with grilled cheese), “pan de arroz” (bread based on rice and milk), maize empanadas (based on corn flour and cheese),  and others. These are some of the traditional baked goods, accompanied by tea or coffee, that help to get through the warm afternoons in the region.

He says that sales have grown a lot since he started and that there is always someone who wants a cuñapé and a hot coffee, especially in the winter.
 
His business benefits from the fact that traditional baked goods are very popular and sell regularly. The disadvantage is that he must walk great distances to sell his baked goods. His dream is to have his own store. He hopes to grow his business by renting a kiosk where he can offer tea and coffee service.

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the year that he has been involved in this activity. These are the reasons that Luís is seeking a loan to rent a kiosk, in order to offer tea and coffee service along with traditional baked goods, so that he can pay for expenses for his baby.

loans.use: to offer tea and coffee service to accompany traditional baked goods, to cover expenses for his baby.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge es de la Ciudad de Paraguarí, vive en casa de sus padres, es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 3 años, por quien él está esforzándose para sacarlo adelante.
Él tiene una despensa hace aproximadamente 4 años, que le va muy  bien y que posee clientela Formada en el barrio, su objetivo es de ir agrandando su negocio de acuerdo a los años así para poder tener un mejor ingreso para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge is from the city of Paraguarí and lives at his parents’ house. He is single but he has a three-year-old son, so he is striving to help him get ahead.

Jorge has been managing a food pantry for approximately four years. He is doing very well and has an established clientele in his neighborhood. His goal is to expand his business as the years go by so that he can have more income to help his loved ones.

Jorge is requesting this loan so that he can buy vegetables, meat, greens, and other products so that he can continue his sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, greens, and other products.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura está en el quinto año de la carrera de ciencias contables, comenta que vive con sus abuelos, su deseo es poder terminar su carrera y poder seguir estudiando más adelante una vez terminada su carrera.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder ir abriéndose camino en el mundo laboral, es por ello que está poniendo todo su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Laura is in her fifth year of study toward a degree in Accounting Sciences. She says that she lives with her grandparents. Her wish is to finish her degree so that she continue studying later on after she is done with this program.

Laura is doing everything she can to open doors into the workplace. For this reason, she is trying to do her best. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en:
Ameer is a 20-year-old single man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Ameer has a barber shop in the city which has been open for the past year. The family also has some agricultural land where they plant seasonal crops without using chemicals. They also use greenhouses. 
Ameer took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to fix the green houses and build more on the family land. This will improve the family business and expand it. Ameer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to fix the green houses and build more on the family land

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 59-year-old married father of seven children. He is an Egyptian citizen working hard in Lebanon for the past twenty years to support his family and to provide them with a better standard of living through developing his small grocery store to make sure it will increase his income.
Ibrahim is a hard working man, he is acquiring his fourth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special Spring and Summer beverages and special offer products that will increase his income and develop his business properly.
This is Ibrahim's fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, his previous loans had a very good impact on his social and financial situation.
He hopes that in the future, he can develop his business properly and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special Spring and Summer beverages and special offer products that will increase his income and develop his business properly

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her local area. Anastacia has been in the business for more than 3 years now. Anastacia is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits among others. Anastacia believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Aniana

texts.en: Aniana is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through her retail store business. She sells various goods such as canned goods and soft drinks. Aniana would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. Aniana hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is a married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store in her place. Antonina has been in the business for more than 20 years now. She sells various goods and food items to the people in her place. Antonina is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments among others. Antonina believes that through this loan she will be able to attract more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia, age 58, is a sari-sari or variety store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. Delia has operated her store for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income. Delia is asking for a loan to buy more stocks such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits among others. Delia hopes to expand her store in the future thus generating more revenue..

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her store

loans.name: Christylen

texts.en:
Christylen works hard to support her family. Christylen is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional lumber, paint, nails, etc .

Christylen has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Christylen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional lumber, paint, nails, etc

loans.name: David

texts.en: Speaking with David, it becomes obvious that he is a very hardworking and helpful man, and that everything he does is for his family's benefit and wellbeing. He lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale along with his wife and their angelic looking children. He has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. He has been doing agriculture for 22 years now. He makes money selling produce from his farm, including milk, eggs and crops. He enjoys plowing his farm and watering his plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for him, and also poor productivity. David is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, he plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on his farm. Increased productivity will allow him to improve his quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, he has learned about the culture of saving, and he plans to use the increased income to improve his farming. This loan will go a long way in permanently changing the life of David and his family. Kindly help him out!

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como un hombre amable y carismático, con 33 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de productos lácteos que comenzó hace aproximadamente 3 años; allí tiene la ventaja de tener una muy buena ubicación, pues se encuentra en el parque principal del municipio donde reside. 

Su experiencia en ventas la obtuvo trabajando en diferentes tiendas y almacenes, por lo que su conocimiento en el manejo de comercio es amplio. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor de queso, quesito, leche, suero, entre otros, así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, en la que pueda compartir con su familia y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is known as a friendly and charismatic man by his customers.  He is 33 years old and owns his own business.  He started selling dairy products about three years ago.  He has the advantage of being very well located in the main park in the town where he lives.

He has sales experience from working in different stores and markets, so he has a lot of knowledge about managing a business.

He is requesting this loan to purchase stock at wholesale, including cheese, quesito [a Colombian soft cheese], milk, whey, and other items.  This will allow him to have more variety to offer his customers and be able to satisfy different tastes and needs.  He will be able to generate more sales and income to continue working toward his goal of improving the condition of his home that he shares with his family.  He hopes that his business will be more profitable so that he can give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, quesito [a Colombian soft cheese], milk, whey, and other items at wholesale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Herminia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Manegre 06 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr MATHIEU est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 06 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 05 enfants  vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 18 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 05 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne  assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Mathieu is in charge of the Manegre 06 Sapone group. He is married and the father of six children between the ages of 3 and 19. Five of his children go to school and he has seven dependents. 

Mr. Mathieu has been raising livestock for 18 years. He buys supplies in the neighboring markets. 

With the money he receives, he will buy five sheep. He will use the income from his loan to reinvest in his business. He would like to secure his children's schooling.

loans.use: buy five sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of fresh and seasonal fruits and vegetables for her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for his new office and also land surveyor tools.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es la mayor de tres hermanos, la misma se desempeña como anfitriona en una entidad bancaria para poder solventar sus gastos universitarios y ayudar a su familia a contar con una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está estudiando para ser licenciada en tribulación, por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino al mundo profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y seguir estudiando de este forma.
texts.en:
Maria is the oldest of three children. Maria works in a banking institution in order to cover her university costs and to support her family to obtain a better quality of life. 

Maria is studying a degree in taxation. By studying, Maria is on her way to having a professional career. 

Maria has requested this loan to be able to pay for her university fees and thus continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a sari-sari store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. This 54-year-old mother of 2 has been in the business for more than 7 years now. She sells various goods like snack foods, toiletries, and cooking materials to the people in her community. 

Elena wants to take a loan to buy more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, bread, biscuits, and chips. 

Elena believes that with a loan, she will be able to increase her store’s inventory and thus attract more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, bread, biscuits, and chips.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Josephine is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 1 year. However, she also earns additional income from fish vending.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with help from the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her son to purchase seasonal and fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una estudiante que se esfuerza para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida, quiere ser abogada, y es por ello que esta poniendo todo de si para poder lograrlo, a través de su anterior préstamo pago sus cuotas, lo cual le fue muy útil.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo, ya que con el podrá pagar sus cuotas y seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus metas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Diana is a student who is striving to grow and make something out of her life. She wants to become a lawyer. For this reason, she is doing all she can to achieve this goal. With her previous loan, she was able to pay her fees, which was a very useful.

Today Diana is requesting a new loan so that she can pay her fees and continue her studies. She will be able to strive toward her goals just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old, married father of two children, and a Palestinian Refugee who has been employed in a ceramics factory since 2006, with a limited income, barely enough to cover his family's increasing living needs.

Since their living needs and requests are increasing, Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for the government's requested electricity providing machine, which is necessary for providing his family with electricity at home. He hopes that he can stay capable of developing his family's living and providing them with a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the government's requested electricity providing machine, which is necessary for providing his family with electricity at home.

loans.name: Marta Eugenia

texts.es: Marta de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una sala de belleza ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene 10 años de dedicare esa actividad la cual le ha generado buenos ingresos con los cuales a logrado salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los productos necesarios como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marta, 30, lives in her own house with her husband and her son.  She has a beauty salon located in her residence.  She has been doing this work for ten years and it has generated good income which has allowed her to get ahead.
She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary products such as creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, among other things that she needs and in this way she will be able to obtain better earnings which will allow her to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Jenylyn

texts.en:
Jenylyn is a 30-year-old married woman, and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.
