His work is located in Sacaba, a rural area located 13 kilometers to the east of the city, known for its cuisine based in guinea pigs and is famous for its many chicha factories that make corn chicha (which is a ferment of corn), of a nice flavor. The village is known jokingly as "Sacaba - where the chicha never runs out". It has a temperate climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 19-25 degrees centigrade. 

Jose has dark skin, dark eyes, wears glasses, has short, straight, black hair, is short, has a medium physique, and his native language is Quechua which he speaks in this place and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the work that he does. He shares his life with his partner who works selling vegetables and with his children who are students. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting that has electricity. To get water, they have to walk about 10 minutes to the river to collect water in buckets and put it in barrels for different uses. He works in a ceramics factory, in quality control for the products, work that he does on a consistent schedule from Monday to Friday. "In 3 years since I built my house, we have not had potable water because the service is new in the zone..." he says. The advantage of his work is that it leaves the weekends free to be with his family and the disadvantage is that the days are long. His dream is to have potable water in his house. He wants to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area so that his family doesn't use the dirty water from the river. 

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that he has worked on the construction of his house. 

For these reasons, Jose asks for a loan to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area so that his family can stop using the dirty water from the river.

loans.use: to instal potable water in his kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area so that his family can stop using the dirty water from the river.

loans.name: Niem

texts.en:
Niem is a 27-years-old. woman who lives with her husband and two children. Her family’s income comes from fishing and raising animals.  

She will use the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Pour  acheter de spaghetti pour la restauration

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 50-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of seven and seventeen.  Rosemarie works hard to provide for her children by buying and selling  vegetables and rice. She has been in business for five years and will use the loan to buy more vegetables, rice, and fertilizer for her farm.  

Rosemarie hope to expand her business with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, rice, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 46-year-old married woman with two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. He needs additional capital to grow his business. Razia requests  a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell to respond quickly to customer needs. 

The profit will be used for savings and paying the electricity and gas bills. Razia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase in her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Sarah works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and raising livestock. Sarah is borrowing PHP12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil and sweet potatoes for her business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through the past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grains of rice

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 27-year-old single man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. Fadi and his brothers work as construction workers. He would like to start his own business, which is an olive farm. It is a very good business, and they have very fertile soil in the village.

Fadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy olive seedlings for his new farm. This will help increase his income and improve the family's living conditions.

Fadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy olive seedlings for his new farm.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Tita operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods such as biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, eggs, soap, noodles, chips, and seasonings.

She is a mother of three children. Two of them are still attending school. In addition to that, she also engages in gardening, to have a supplemental income.

Tita is asking for a loan to buy grocery items including drinks, and farm supplies like fertilizers and seedlings. These are essentials tools in making improvements in the stock for the store, as well as her farming livelihood. In these ways, she can provide fr the needs of her growing children and be able to continue to send her children to school.

She is hoping that she can manage her business properly for the welfare of her growing children and also for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy grocery items including drinks, and farm supplies like fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals and balanced feed to fatten them

loans.name: Serghei

texts.en: Serghei is an entrepreneur from the city of Soroca who recently opened a small factory producing briquettes. The briquettes are made from tightly compacted straw, sawdust, wood branches, and corn stalks. He is young, ambitious and with ideas to do great things to protect the environment. Serghei is 35 years old, has higher education, married and has one child. Two years ago he came up with the idea to produce briquettes which are efficient, cheap and use recycled materials. So he rolled up his sleeves and began to work to make his dream a reality. This last fall he began to produce his first briquettes but this was met with some challenges along the way. Though these challenges have motivated him to work even harder to make his dream a reality. In order to be competitive in the market, Serghei needs a powerful machine that costs approximatively $4,000. With $1,200 being personal contribution from Serghei, which leaves $2,800 the amount being requested. Purchasing this machine will allow Serghei to produce briquettes more efficiently. He believe that his briquettes, which used recycled material, can help avoid the clearing of trees thus protecting a valuable element to the environment. This machine will also allow the business the possibility to expand, which result in the creation of new jobs for the local community.

loans.use: To pay for a machine to produce briquettes using recycled materials.

loans.name: Eder David

texts.es:
Eder un joven de 25 años de edad, trabajador, muy estético y pulido en sus trabajos, se dedica a la fabricación de muebles en madera, su trabajo es de mucha calidad tal y como podemos ver en la foto, pero le falta algo y es que el servicio de pintura del mueble lo tiene que subcontratar y eso le cuesta más dinero por ello tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de un comprensor y las tintas para el mismo realizar ese trabajo.

EL mayor beneficio que obtendrá es el ahorro y el control de tiempos de entrega de sus productos, una ganancia bastante buena que apoyara al crecimiento de este joven que solo sueña con ser lo suficiente para generar ingresos que le permitan mantener y pagar la educación de sus hijos y pareja.
texts.en:
Eder is a 25-year-old young man. He is hard-working, very aesthetic and refined in his work. He makes a living building wooden furniture. His work is very high quality as we can see in the photo. But he is missing something and that is that he has to subcontract a furniture painting service and that costs him more money. For this reason he decided to request a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of a compressor and dyes to be able to do this work on his own. 

The greatest benefit that he will obtain is savings and control of the delivery times of his products, a sufficiently good earning that will support the growth of this young man who only dreams of being sufficient to generate incomes that will allow him to maintain and pay for the education of his children and partner.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and dyes to be able to do this work on his own.

loans.name: Iana

texts.en: Iana is a 39 year old woman from the village of Rudi, in the district of Soroca. She is married, has two children and works in the processing of apple orchards. She began working in agriculture about 12 years ago and now together with her husband, they are working 4 hectares of their own orchards. 1.5 hectares is an old orchard made up of autumn varieties and the remaining 2.5 hectares is a young orchard growing summer varieties. The agricultural work is carried out at the family level, and when the work demands more manpower, they are hiring seasonal workers. The biggest problem faced by the family, is the lack of needed agricultural equipment and because of this they are unable to process the orchards in the correct time period. They have a T40 tractor and some agricultural equipment that is old and doesn’t meet the requirements needed. Mrs. Iana’s dream is to procure the correct agricultural equipment (plow, cultivator and rake). She will personally contribute $1,500 but requires a loan of $ 3,000 for her dream to come true. With the new equipment she will be able to perform timely care of the orchards which will allow her to bring in a rich harvest. Which will not only allow for the business to develop even more in the future but can also result in the creation of new jobs as the business grows.

loans.use: To pay for agricultural equipment to maintain orchards.

loans.name: Encarnacion De Jesus

texts.es: Hace muchos años Don Encarnación comenzó en el mundo de la vulcanización ayudándole a su hermano en su negocio, luego el negocio pasó a manos de Don Encarnación y logro obtener una amplia clientela y un local prospero. Para seguir brindando su servicio solicita un crédito para comprar llantas y materiales de reparación de llantas, de esta manera podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener ganancias para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Many years ago Don Encarnación started in the world of vulcanization helping her brother in his business. Then the business passed hands to Don Encarnación and he managed to obtain a wide clientele and a prosperous place. To continue providing his services he is requesting a loan to buy tires and materials to repare tires. In this way he will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers and obtain profits to improve the infrastructure of his business.

loans.use: to buy tires and materials to repair tires.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 52-year-old, married woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She is married with three sons. Leonora has been engaged in the hog-raising or piggery business for ten years. This is where she gets her income to supply her daily needs. Her husband also works as a driver.  Leonora is requesting a loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements. Through this loan, Leonora will be able to raise pigs in her house and create more income. 

In the future, Leonora  dreams of expanding her business and becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grains of rice

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 36 años, ella vive junto a su pareja e hija de 14 años de edad, la cual ama y protege y quiere darle lo mejor de ella para que se eduque y se forme como una persona íntegra y alegre.

Dora se dedica a ofertar servicios de arreglo de uñas y peinados a domicilios, no cuenta con un local propio y lleva realizando dicha profesión por más de 20 años, siendo muy reconocida en el sector que es su principal ventaja con respecto a la competencia.

Su mayor deseo es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, aumentar sus ventas, tener continuidad en su negocio y emprender un proyecto que será tener un local donde se radicara.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido para su negocio, principalmente esmaltes, comprara tintura, shampo y gel para cabello, exfoliantes y accesorios los cuales les oferta a los clientes al finalizar el servicio.

Este apoyo ayudara al cliente a tener herramientas de trabajo para generar los ingresos que necesita para darle rienda suelta a sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Dora is a 36-year-old woman who lives with her partner and a 14-year-old daughter. She loves her daughter and wants to give her the best she can, so that she can receive a good education and becomes an integral and joyful person.

Dora visits her clients’ homes on request and offers manicure, pedicure and hairstyling. She does not own a salon. She has been doing this for more than twenty years and is very well-known in the area, which is a good advantage she has over her competitors. Her biggest dream is to be able to pay for her children’s education, increase her sales, keep her business running, and buy a salon.

Dora is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business, mainly nail polish, hair dye, shampoo, hair gel, exfoliants, and accessories to sell to her clients. This loan will help her to have the tools she needs to generate income and be able to advance with her projects.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as nail polish, hair dyes, shampoo, hair gel, and exfoliants.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María es una orgullosa campesina dedicada al cultivo de café, una actividad que ha desempeñado desde el año 1974 y gracias a ella ha podido sacar adelante a su amplia familia que la terminan de conformar su esposo y nueve hijos, ella inicio la actividad pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y hoy a sus 62 años se sigue despertando a las 4 de la mañana a trabajar en sus cultivos de café hasta que se oculta el sol.

Ella centra todos sus sueños es sus cultivos, quiere ampliar su terreno para dejarle una buena herencia a su familia.

Marta quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, el monto es justificado, con las hectáreas del terreno y el alto costo de los insumos.

El préstamo lo invertirá en abonos, fertilizantes fungicidas, productos indispensables para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
María is proud of being a farmer. She has been growing coffee since 1974, which has helped her to get ahead with her big family, comprised of her husband and nine children. She started growing coffee because she liked it and felt it was her vocation to be independent. Today, she is 62 years old, and still wakes up at 4 am to work in her coffee plantations until the sun goes down. All her dreams are about her plantations. She wants to buy more land in order to leave her family a good legacy.

María is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies. She needs the requested amount because her plantations are big and the supplies are expensive. She will buy fertilizers, and fungicides, which are essential supplies for the maintenance of her plantations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides for the maintenance of her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Berta Ines

texts.es:
Berta una abuela muy laboriosa, empeñada en sacar a delante su familia, junto a ella se encuentra la persona que más adorada que es su nieta la cual cuida todos los días, ella tiene una responsabilidad muy grande la cual es mantener su hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, con los ingresos que obtiene del negocio paga las deudas, comida y el estudio de su pequeña nieta.

La vivienda en la que habita Berta es propia, pero siempre se ha mantenido igual y ahora quiere realizar algunas mejoras locativas, necesarias ya que presenta algunas humedades en los muros y necesita unas reparaciones en los techos para evitar que se filtre el agua.

Berta quiere solicitar un préstamo que está muy dirigido a la ampliación de su negocio, lo invertirá en la mejora y adecuación de una cochera, comprara un cerda de cría, alimento y ya con dos cocheras espera que sus ingresos crezcan para poder realizar las mejoras mencionadas en el segundo párrafo.
texts.en:
Berta is a hardworking grandmother, committed to the success of her family. Together with her is the most beloved person which is her granddaughter whom she takes care of every day. She has a very big responsibility to take care of her home. She makes a living raising pigs, and with the profits that she obtains from the business she pays her debts, and for food and the studies of her little granddaughter.

The house in which Berta lives is her own, but it has always stayed the same and now she wants to make some local, necessary improvements. There is already some dampness in the walls and she needs some reparations to the roof to prevent water from leaking.

Berta wants to request a loan that is targeted to expand her business. She will invest it in the adaptation and improvement of a garage, will buy one breeding sow, food and two garages. She hopes that her income grows to be able to make the improvements mentioned in the second paragraph.

loans.use: to expand her business, she will construct a carport for pigs and buy a breeding sow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of garments to resell.

loans.name: Eduardo Manuel

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre amable, humilde, sonriente, tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa con la cual quiere progresar, salir adelante, buscar juntos un futuro más estable para traer niños al mundo.

Eduardo se dedica al negocio de la panadería, el cual tiene ubicado en su tienda, el prepara productos no para vender en su casa si no para distribuir en supermercados y tiendas, ya que los empaca y los vende en 6,8 y 12 unidades por bolsa.

Su negocio está empezando a crecer y cada vez presenta una mayor demanda, esto lo motiva y lo enorgullece ya que está realizando un buen trabajo viéndose muy beneficiado en la parte económica que es lo que busca para lograr una buena estabilidad económica que le permita crecer y proyectarse a convertirse en una gran distribuidora de productos de panadería.

Eduardo Solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en materia prima para la fabricación de productos de panadería, comprara una carreta para transportar los productos y bolsas para empacarlos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a kind, humble and smiling man. He is 28 years old and lives with his wife. He wants to get ahead with her and try to build a more stable future for their unborn children.

Eduardo has a bakery at home, but he does not sell bread there. He sells his bread to different supermarkets and stores, in bags of 6, 8 and 12 pieces. His business is starting to grow together with the demand. This motivates him and makes him proud of doing a good work, which is good for his financial situation. His goal is to reach financial stability in order to grow and become a great distributor of bakery products.

Eduardo is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make bakery products. He will buy bags to pack them, and a cart to deliver them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bakery products, bags to pack them, and a cart to deliver them.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a 20-year-old single man who has been an employee in a mobile phone sales shop for seven years. Hadi was only thirteen years old when he started working in order to help his parents with their living and cover his own expenses.

Hadi is an ambitious man who is trying desperately to improve his living conditions, so today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to become a partner with his manager in the mobile phone sales shop.

Hadi is a man with a very good reputation, and is well known in his region. He is a hard worker who hopes to reach a level where he can settle down and enjoy developing his own business in the future.

loans.use: to become a partner with his manager in the mobile phone sales shop

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of her income.

Rizza is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. Rizza believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 45-year-old woman and mother of 7 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a food stall where he sells different types of eatable items (e.g. samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kabab paratha, etc.) Her husband is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Sajida's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purposes so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Sajida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 37 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feeds and other veterinary supplies. Teresita has been fattening pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from selling piglets.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and other veterinary supplies

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is the age of 57 and is living in Lahore with her husband and six children. 

Her son has been running a beauty salon for many years. He has been using salon instruments for many years and the instruments are wearing out and need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments.

Due to his low purchasing power, Mussarat requested a loan so that her son can become empowered and he can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair.

Mussarat hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some savings for household expenses. Mussarat thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair for her son's beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her son to buy a new moto-rickshaw body.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Agé de 38 ans, Kossi est un homme marié qui vit à Adidogomé pour entreprendre ses activités. Kossi est très dynamique et vend des vitres d’image à ses clients et trouve favorablement sa rentabilité grâce à ce commerce. Kossi s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Pour commander quelques vitres pour diversifier ses expositions et attirer plus de clients, Kossi sollicite ce microcrédit pour la réalisation de ses objectifs et pourvoir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: 38-year-old Kossi is a married man who lives in Adidogomé, where he carries out his business. Kossi is a highly dynamic vendor who sells painted glass images to his customers. He is able to earn a decent living from this activity. Kossi buys new stock from the marketplace twice monthly. In order to stock more paintings to diversity his range and attract more customers. Kossi is requesting this loan to bring his goals to fruition and meet his family's needs.

loans.use: acheter 72 vitres

loans.name: Aichatou

texts.fr: Aichatou est une femme célibataire sans enfant. Aichatou est âgée de 21 ans et travaille dynamiquement pour son bien-être. Aichatou vit à Adidogomé pour vendre des céréales dans les marchés et parcoure les quartiers pour satisfaire ses clients. Pour disposer de sa marchandise en permanence, Aichatou s’approvisionne six fois par mois dans un marché du quartier. Aichatou demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de maïs et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: 21-year-old Aichatou is a single woman who doesn't have any children. She is a dynamic worker who works for her own well-being. Aichatou lives in Adidogomé, where she sells cereals at the local markets and as street vendor in order to meet her customers' needs. In order to have a regular supply of stock, Aichatou gets her supplies six times per month from a local market. She is requesting this loan so she can stock bowls of maize and increase her profit margins.

loans.use: to purchase 75 bowls of maize

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 31 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает в детском саду, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она уже 5 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Наргизы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы, 15 овец, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Наргизы составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). Наргиза обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки овец. Наргиза намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота и развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Nargiza is 31 and married with two children. She has a higher education and works in a kindergarten. She has also been working in animal husbandry for five years as an additional source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, purposefulness and effort she now has two cows, 15 sheep and two horses, with a total monthly income of about 18,000 KGS. 

Nargiza has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She intends to increase her head count of livestock even further and to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep to invest in her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 55 years old and married with eight children, She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre perspicaz, aprovecha y explota las oportunidades que se le presentan, siempre se ha destacado por ser una persona independiente, le gusta el emprendimiento y por ello tiene una cría de ganado porcino.

A sus 38 años es padre de 3 hijos, los cuales ama y apoya incondicionalmente, emocional y financieramente, se preocupa porque estudien, tengan una vestimenta, porque no les falte comida y aparte de eso por pagar las deudas de su hogar.

Alexander quiere solicitar un préstamo la razón es que busca  surtir sus cocheras que en el momento se encuentra vacías tal y como se ve en la foto, la razón es que no puede realizar una inversión tan grande uno porque no cuenta con el capital en el momento y dos por sus obligaciones como padre, por ello pide apoyo ya que le queda más cómodo y fácil pagarlo por cuotas
texts.en:
Alexander is a perceptive man.  He takes advantage of and develops the opportunities that arise.  He has always stood out for being an independent person.  He likes entrepreneurship, and he therefore has a business of raising pigs.

He is 38 years old, and he has three children.  He loves them and supports them unconditionally, emotionally, and financially.  He is concerned about their education, that they have clothing, and that they do not go without food.  He is also concerned about paying the household debts.

Alexander wants to request a loan to stock his pens.  They are now empty, as can be seen in the photo.  The reason is that he is not able to make such a big investment for two reasons.  First, he does not have the capital now.  Second, he has obligations as a father.  Therefore, he is requesting support, which is more comfortable and easy to repay in payments.

loans.use: to buy pigs to stock his pens.

loans.name: Knart's Group

texts.en:
A father of one child, living in Kampong Cham province, Knart is 24 years old. He can earn income to support his family via growing cassava and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. He has been involved this business for ages and it earns him about 37,600 KHR per day. This is his second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan.

 In a group of three, he is the group leader and he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support his cassava farm. He hopes that he can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support his cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 45, mother of five children, and living in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a medical clinic in which she provides first aid services to patients. She has been practicing as a medical nurse in a hospital and now wants to start her own clinic on the basis of her experience. She has been dealing with many cases of pregnancy as well and did many successful operations. She is a very famous nurse in her area and the ladies have full confidence in her abilities. 

Rubina has become very famous in their society and wants to establish her clinic through buying beds and medicines  so she can provide good services to her patients.

Therefore, Rubina requested a loan; she hopes that now she can easily buy the beds and medicines for her clinic.

loans.use: to buy beds and medicines for her own medical clinic

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Suriya is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

Suriya needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these supplies. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above supplies and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business and buy necessary supplies for sewing

loans.name: Elisha's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Elisha, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 67 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Elisha is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Elisha says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has learnt a lot from farming training, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Elisha will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres and given that some of the members of the group will purchase solar lights, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights among them.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Eyouda

texts.fr: Eyouda est une femme divorcée et âgée de 38 ans. Eyouda vit à Agoè avec trois enfants à sa charge. Eyouda est une commerçante de friperies qui parcoure les quartiers afin de gagner le revenu pour soutenir les besoins de sa famille. Eyouda s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Eyouda demande ce financement pour commander des caleçons afin d’avoir plus de bénéfices pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en: Eyouda is a 38-year-old divorcee who lives in Agoe with her three children. She sells used clothing as a street vendor in order to earn enough money to support her family's needs. Eyouda gets her supplies four times per month from the market. She is requesting this loan to order used boxer shorts so she can increase her earnings and ensure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase two piles of boxer shorts

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana is a 25-year-old business woman, volunteer teacher, and single mother. For business, Yohana deals in the buying and selling of women’s clothing. She uses her profits to pay for her younger brothers’ and sisters’ school materials. 

Yohana is now asking for a Kiva loan in order to expand her clothing business and to rent a store-frame where she can establish a settled business - especially important during the rainy season. Through her lessons as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Yohana encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. 

The interest on Yoahana’s “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to rent a store-frame and protect her clothing business during the rainy season

loans.name: Saylamo

texts.ru: Сайламо проживает на районе под названием Руми. Ей 38 лет. Сайламо уже 5 лет работает в сфере торговли. Она занимается продажей фруктов овощей и салатов домашнего приготовления. Также Сайламо работает в пекарне и печет лепешки. Сайламо обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. На часть денег она увеличит ассортимент овощей и фруктов, на другую часть купит муку и другие ингредиенты для приготовления лепешек. Сайламо надеется, что Вы  ее поддержите, и она осуществит свой план.
texts.en:
Saylamo is 38 and lives in the Rumi region. She has been working in retail for five years. She sells fruit, vegetables and homemade salads. She also works in a bakery and makes flatbreads.

Saylamo is looking for a loan because she wants to expand her business and attract more customers. She will use part of the loan amount to increase her assortment of fruits and vegetables and the rest to purchase flour and other ingredients to make flatbreads. She hopes that you will support her and that she will be able to carry out her plans.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of fruits and vegetables, and to buy flour to make flatbreads

loans.name: Charkinoy

texts.ru: Чаркиной 29 летняя жительница района Бохтар, жена и мать троих детей. Ее муж находится за приделами страны на заработках. Чаркиной дома предоставляет услуги по шитью женской национальной одежды. Она любит свою работу. Для нее такая работа очень удобная. Она может заниматься домашними делами и зарабатывать дома. К тому же найти работу на районе очень тяжело. Чаркиной обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Она хочет создать себе условия работы, и новая швейная машинка окажет влияние на результат ее работы. Чаркиной надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны и верит в Вас.
texts.en:
Charkinoy is 29 and a resident of the Bohtar region. She is married and has three children. Her husband works abroad and she works at home sewing women's clothing in the national style. She loves her work and it suits her very well since she is able to take care of her household chores and earn money at home. Besides this, it's very hard to find work in her region.

Charkinoy is looking for a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine. She wants to improve her working conditions and a new sewing machine will have a positive effect on the quality of her work. She hopes for your support and trusts in you.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru:
Это Салима. Она в районе занимается растениеводством. Салима продвигает деятельность мамы. Она начала заняться 6 лет назад. Салима серьезная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 59 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Салима вместе семьей проживает в районе Пяндж. 
Салима обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрение. Обычно сельские жители взвешивает минеральные удобрение с землюй. Минеральные удобрение помогает получить богатый и качественный урожай. Салима перед сева урожай хочет обработать землю с минеральными удобрениями. Чтобы приобрести минеральные удобрение у нее нет денежных средств, поэтому она берет кредит. Ваша поддержка поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
This is Salima. She is a serious and hardworking woman of 59. She is married and has two children, and lives with her family in the Pyandj region. She works in agriculture, a business she started six years ago, as well as taking care of her family.

Salima is looking for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. People usually mix these fertilizers into the soil to help them receive a rich and high-quality harvest. She wants to fertilize the land before she sows it, but doesn't have enough money to buy the fertilizers she needs, which is why she is taking out a loan. Your support will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es:
Ponciano es un hombre de 45 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos varones de 6 años y 1 bebé de 2 meses y una hija mujer de 10 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de adobes.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, generoso, optimista, responsable y trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ situada a 14 kilómetros de la ciudad, sitio donde tienen sus viviendas de residencia los agricultores que cultivan la tierra en el trópico, estas propiedades son utilizadas cuando los campesinos sacan sus cosechas del trópico a comercializarlos en la ciudad. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Ponciano es de tez morena, cabello lacio negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor es un bebé, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la fabricación de adobes. El adobe es un ladrillo, hecho de barro (arcilla y arena) mezclada con paja, moldeada en forma de ladrillo y secada al aire libre, con ellos se construyen paredes y muros. El procedimiento que sigue es; 1- prepara el barro con los pies; pisa el barro mientras lo va mojando, y también canta y baila, 2- agrega la paja picada, 3- llena los moldes  con su mezcla, y 4- deja secar 3 o más días. “aquí en la zona es muy difícil transportar material de construcción, por eso los adobes tienen gran demanda; porque los fabricamos en el mismo lugar de construcción…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que fabrica los materiales de construcción en el mismo lugar de la obra, la desventaja es que en época de lluvia es muy difícil el secado. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable hasta en las épocas de lluvia, él desea realizar la compra de materiales de construcción como; madera, arcilla, paja y otros, necesarios para desarrollar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ponciano solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para fabricar adobes y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ponciano is 45 years old and married. He has two sons including a six-year-old and an infant of two months, and a 10-year-old daughter. He earns a living manufacturing mud bricks.

He's a good father, and an enterprising, generous, upbeat, responsible man who works hard.

His business is in Sacaba, located 14 kilometers away from the city. This is a place of residence for the farmers who cultivate the tropical land, and here are the properties from where the farmers arrive with their tropical harvests to sell in the city. The climate is mild with daylight temperatures ranging from 18 to 25 degrees centigrade.

Ponciano has a dark complexion, black hair that is short and straight, and brown eyes. He has short stature and a slim frame. His mother tongue is Quechua, spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish in the community and for his work.

He shares his life with his wife who works in agriculture, and with his children: the two elder go to school and the youngest is a baby. They live in their own home made of adobe with a corrugated metal roof. They have electricity and well water.

His business is the manufacture of adobe. Adobe is a brick, it is mud (clay and sand) mixed with straw, shaped into brick form and dried in the open air. It is used to build interior and exterior walls.

This is the procedure he follows:
1. He prepares the mud by stepping on it while adding water. He also sings and dances while he does this,
2. He adds the straw,
3. He fills the molds with this mixture,
4. He leaves it to dry for three or more days.

"In this zone, it is very difficult to transport building material, thus there is a great demand for adobe bricks since we make them on site" he comments. 

The advantage in his business is that he makes the bricks at the construction site. The disadvantage is that adobe drying is very difficult during the rainy season. His dream is to keep a steady business going even through the rainy season.

Ponciano is requesting the loan to buy material such as wood, clay, straw, and more needed to make the adobe, so that he can continue developing  his business.

This is his first loan with the institution in the ten years that he's been doing this work.






.

loans.use: to buy material to make adobe bricks and continue with his business.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул вместе семьей живет в районе Пяндж. Ей 53 лет. Она замужем и мать троих сыновей. Муж занимается трактористом в районе. Старший сын женат и имеет двоих детей. Младшие сыновья занимается земледелием, помогает маме. Сама Курбонгул занимается земледелием уже более 10 лет. У нее есть земельный участок, где она выращивает овощи. Данный момент Курбонгул готовится к весеннюю посеву. Ей надо готовит почву, и начать посев урожай. В этом году она хочет посадить морковь и картофель, и по этой причине Курбонгул обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать  ее с финансовыми трудностями. Курбонгул заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Kurbongul and her family live in the Pyandj region. She is 53 and married with three sons. Her husband works locally as a tractor driver. Her oldest son is married and has two children. Her younger sons work in agriculture and help their mother. Kurbongul herself has been working in agriculture for more than 10 years. She has a piece of land where she grows vegetables.

At the moment, Kurbongul is getting ready for the spring planting. She needs to prepare the soil and start planting seeds. This year she wants to plant carrots and potatoes, and for this reason she is looking to you for a loan. You can support her financially. She expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and seed potatoes

loans.name: Mira Joy

texts.en:
Mira Joy is 22 years old with two children. Mira Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Mira Joy runs a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell.

Mira Joy has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future, Mira Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and married with seven children. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, candies, home care products and groceries.

Nancy has been in this business for four years now. 

In the future, Nancy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, candies, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Moul's Group

texts.en:
Moul is a 34-year-old married mother living in Stoung district of Kampong Thom province. She has five children, three of whom are dependent on her. Among these three children, two are studying in high school and one is too young to attend school. For supporting her family, she grows rice as their main source income. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee to supplement her family’s income. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan as well. She is leading the group of six members to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can provide all of her family members with comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Salim Sarid

texts.es:
Salim es un hombre soltero de 44 años de edad que quedo desempleado pero sin quejarse, con un sonrisa en el rostro y mucha esperanza inicio inmediatamente a buscar que hacer, a cómo salir adelante, y con base a unos conocimientos que tenia de vendedor, decidió invertir unos ahorros que tenía en compra de mercancía que es herramienta de mano la cual quiere distribuir en talleres de motos, casas, talleres de vehículo, saliendo un poco de lo común que es montar una tienda o vender productos de uso personal.

Salim no tiene hijos, su preocupación es generar ingresos para su sustento, para apoyar a sus padres y crecer como comerciante, el desea superarse, demostrar que puede ser generador de empleo, que puede montar un almacén de venta de herramienta, hay muchos proyectos que quiere cumplir y solo le queda trabajar con empeño para cumplirlos.

Solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en su totalidad en surtido de herramienta de mano.
texts.en:
Salim, 44, is a single man. He lost his job but does not complain. With a smile on his face and lots of hope, he immediately started to look for something to do in order to get ahead. He had worked as a salesman before, and decided to invest his savings in buying tools for motorcycle and vehicle repair shops, and for home use. This is an unorthodox business, as he could have opened a grocery store or started selling personal products instead.

Salim has no children. He is focused on generating income for his own maintenance, to support his parents, and to grow as a businessman. He wants to better himself and prove that he can open a hardware store and create jobs. He has many projects in mind, and just needs to work hard to make them come true.

Salim is requesting a loan to buy hand tools.

loans.use: to buy hand tools to sell.

loans.name: Ana Leonarda

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy sonriente y alegre, ella es madre de 3 hijos se caracteriza por su buena disponibilidad, amabilidad y cordialidad al atender a un cliente.

Ana inicio un negocio de salsamentaría donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar y bebidas alcohólicas, el proyecto lo inicio en el año 2014 y esta sorprendente mujer ya cuenta con un local y no se quiere detener, busca progresar y brindarles a sus hijos la mejor estabilidad y calidad de vida posible.

Ella desea solicitar un préstamo la razón es que esta en proyectos de invertir en mercancía que no vendía como lo son dulces, chocolates al por mayor, su objetivo es vender unidades pero también cubrir pedidos grandes.

Ana quiere solicitar un préstamo y está muy motivada con el proyecto Interactuar-Kiva, saber que personas de cualquier parte del mundo la pueden apoyar la motiva a seguir haciendo las cosas bien y un compromiso de no defraudar a quien pueda apoyarla.
texts.en:
Ana is a very happy, smiling woman.  She has three children.  She is known for her good availability, friendliness, and cordiality when tending to a customer.  Ana started a business of a small store where she sells basic needs products and alcoholic drinks.  She started the project in 2014, and this surprising woman already has a place.  She does not want to stop.  She is looking to progress and to provide her children with the best stability and quality of life possible.

She wishes to request a loan because she is investing in merchandise that she has not been selling.  She will buy things like sweets and chocolates wholesale.  Her objective is to sell individual items and to also cover large orders.

Ana wishes to request a loan.  She is very motivated by the Interactuar-Kiva project.  Knowing that people from any part of the world can support her motivates her to continue doing things well.  She pledges to not let down those who are able to help her.

loans.use: to buy sweets and chocolates as new products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Gladys, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 41 years old, and as a group leader, she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has three children.

Gladys is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Gladys says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Gladys will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of eight acres. Given that some of the members of the group will be purchasing solar lights, the group will be receiving a total of five solar lights among them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase stylish new  women's clothes in order to resell them to her customers

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 40 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income for household expenses. He always tries to establish his business through offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are very demanding and expensive as well. He is not enough financial strength to buy these expensive beauty products.

This is the reason why Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair coloring, makeover kits, lipsticks, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to enhance the business.
 
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics items for her husband's cosmetics shop

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 23-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one child. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of  the family. Samina is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these supplies. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above supplies and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business through purchasing supplies necessary for sewing

loans.name: Nikki Rose

texts.en:
Nikki Rose is 35 years old and married with two children.

Nikki Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products and groceries.

Nikki Rose has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from an eatery.

Nikki Rose aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette, 36, is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. For three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Bernadette requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy items such as can goods, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her store. In the future Bernadette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Remedios is borrowing 8000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to buy ingredients for her food stall. Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Akouvi  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier d’Agoè avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Akouvi est très dynamique et vend du charbon de bois dans le quartier afin de procurer un bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akouvi demande ce crédit pour commander quelques sacs de charbons de bois pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus
texts.en:
Aged 30, Akouvi  is a married woman living in the Agoè district with her two children for whom she is responsible. Akouvi is very hardworking and sells charcoal in the neighborhood so as to earn the necessary income to cover the needs of her family. She stocks up twice a month in the market. 

Akouvi is requesting this loan to order some sacks of charcoal to resell and earn still more income.

loans.use: to buy nine sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Noemy Esther

texts.es:
Noemy es una mujer casada de 31 años de edad, que inicio un camino como emprendedora el pasado año, como necesidad económica dado que su esposo no podía dar abasto para mantener a sus 4 hijos de 13, 12, 9 y 7 años de edad.

Ante la situación Noemy vio una oportunidad de ubicar en su casa una cría de cerdos y desde entonces ha estado trabajando para mejorar la economía y se está muy contenta porque con sus esfuerzos se ha evidenciado un cambio importante de las condiciones de su familia.

Ella quiere mejorar, aspirar a mejores ventas, incrementar su utilidad, ser más competitiva, tener una sostenibilidad de negocio, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cerdos, alimento y mejoras locativas en sus cocheras.

Como Noemy apenas empieza es importante para ella el préstamo, marcara una gran diferencia porque tendrá un capital para invertirle a su negocio el cual podrá pagar tranquilamente por cuotas.
texts.en:
Noemy is a married woman, age 31, who started on the road to entrepreneurship last year out of necessity, as her husband couldn't keep up with supporting their four children, ages thirteen, twelve, nine, and seven.

Faced with the situation, Noemy saw an opportunity for locating a pig raising business at their house, and since then, she has been working to improve their finances. She is very happy because with her efforts, there has been a clear and significant change in her family’s conditions.

She wants to improve, aspire to better sales, increase her profits, be more competitive, and have a sustainable business.  That is why she wants to request a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of pigs, feed, and improvements to her pens.  

Because Noemy is just getting started, the loan is important for her; it will make a huge difference, as she will have the capital to invest in her business, and will be able to comfortably pay it off in installments.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and make improvements to her pens.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Josephine vit à Agoè et est agée de 32 ans. Josephine est une femme divorcée et habite avec un enfant à sa charge. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Josephine vend du maïsé afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant aider ses enfants dans les charges quotidiennes. Josephine s’approvisionne  deux  fois par mois au marché pour alimenter son stock. Josephine demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de maïs afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce.
texts.en: Josephine lives in Agoè and is 32 years old. She is divorced and lives with one child in her care. In order to be able to provide more easily for her daily needs, Josephine sells "maïsé" (made from corn) so that she can have an income and help her children with the daily outgoings. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market so she can build up her stock. She is requesting this loan so she can buy sacks of corn and make sufficient income to meet her challenges and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of corn.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Agée de 25 ans, Akpéné  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier d’Agoè avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Akpéné est très dynamique et vend de la pâte emballée préparée à l’aide du maïs pour ses clients. Son activité ne lui procure pas assez de bénéfices pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Akpéné s’approvisionne deux  fois par mois au marché. Akpéné demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs  de maïs afin de préparer une bonne quantité de ses nourritures aux clients et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en: Akpéné is a 25-year old married woman who lives in the Agoè district with her two children in her care. She is very dynamic and sells packaged dough made with corn for her customers. Her activity does not generate enough profit for her to help out with the family's needs. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Akpéné is requesting this loan so that she can order sacks of corn in order to prepare a good quantity of food for her customers and make more money.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 58 years old and has five children. He is a widowed man. Rolando is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

He requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise his livestock.

Rolando has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, he would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for his livestock

loans.name: Eusebia Rosa

texts.es:
Eusebia es una mujer casada, vive muy tranquila y feliz en el campo, se dedica a la venta de gallinas y realiza preparaciones como almuerzos y desayunos por encargos, dicha actividad le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y ser un gran apoyo para su esposo.

Ella es madre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad, tienen su respectiva familia por lo que solo tiene a su esposo como apoyo incondicional en su hogar y entre ambos se colaboran mucho.

Ella es de una zona rural, es difícil el desplazamiento, pero ella a pesar de no haberse educado es muy inteligente ya que con sus buenas decisiones ha mantenido el negocio y va creciendo poco a poco.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra insumos para realizar alimentos como frijoles, lentejas, arroz, plátano, carne entre otros y compra de gallinas y pollos en grandes cantidades.

La razón del monto es que por el difícil desplazamiento y por ahorro le sale mejor comprar todo en una sola ida al pueblo.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a married woman, she lives a tranquil and happy life in the countryside. 

Eusebia makes a living from selling chickens and preparing breakfasts and lunches for delivery. This work has given her the opportunity to improve her living conditions and has been a great support to her husband. 

Eusebia has two adult children, they have their own families, so she only has her husband at home, they support each other unconditionally.  

Eusebia is from a rural area where getting around was difficult, and so was education. Despite her lack of education, Eusebia is intelligent and has made wise decisions in her business which have helped it to increase. 

Eusebia is seeking a loan to buy supplies to cook with, such as beans, lentils, rice, bananas and meat, and to buy roosters and chickens in wholesale quantities. The reason for buying in bulk is because of the the difficulty of transport and it is much cheaper to buy it all in just one trip to town.

loans.use: to prepare lunches and buy criolle chickens.

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Khen, 45, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and is a mother of four children. She strives to help her family’s hardship via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. For Khen, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, Khen will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

She hopes that she can get a greater yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo habite à Agoè aves ses deux enfants à charge. Adjo est une femme mariée et âgée de 39 ans. Pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille, Adjo vend des pagnes dans son atelier de couture. Cette activité lui permet  d’avoir un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Adjo s’approvisionne  deux  fois par mois au marché. Adjo demande ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagne d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo lives in Agoè with her two children, who are dependants. She is a 39-year old married women. In order to be able to provide for her family's daily needs, Adjo sells "pagnes" (pieces of colorful fabric) in her sewing workshop. This activity allows her to have a sufficient income to feed the family. Adjo gets her supplies twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan so she can buy pieces of "pagne" fabric and make enough profit to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seven pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Sothen's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Sothen, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by seven farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to four children; he is known by his community as a very trustworthy person.

Initially, Sothen joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has learned a lot from farming training. Sothen will be receiving a solar light which he is so excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel therefore saving more money. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Sothen plans to send his children to school.

Between the seven farmers in Sothen's Group, a total of three acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. In addition, a total of five solar lights will be received between them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Béza

texts.fr: Béza vit à Agoè aves deux enfants à sa charge. Béza est une femme veuve et âgée de 42 ans. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Béza vend des fruits de bonne qualité afin d’avoir un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Béza s’approvisionne  deux fois par mois au marché afin de vendre efficacement ses marchandises. Béza demande ce crédit pour acheter des tas de fruits d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce.
texts.en: Béza lives in Agoè with two children in her care. She is a 42-year old widow. In order to be able to provide for the family's daily needs she sells good quality fruit so she can have sufficient income to feed them. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market so she can sell her goods in an efficient manner . Béza is requesting this loan so she can buy piles of fruit and make enough profit to rise to her challenges and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 12 piles of bananas, 20 piles of oranges and 20 piles of avocados.

loans.name: Norte Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Norte Poty,  cuenta con 17 miembros, se encuentra en el 1er ciclo. Contentas y agradecidas por la oportunidad de inversión que están recibiendo. Cada una de las mujeres que forman este equipo, son personas humildes y trabajadoras.
Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Josefa quien es vendedora de chipas, (un alimento típico paraguayo) que está trabajando y pide este préstamo para tener  un local propio para la preparación y venta de chipa, lo que le ayudaría a aumentar sus ingresos mensuales.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que se está esforzando para poder crecer y salir adelante. Quiere capacitarse e ir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The committee named “Norte Poty” has 17 members and is participating in its first loan cycle. The members are pleased and grateful to receive this opportunity to invest. The women who have formed this team are humble and hardworking people.

One of the women who stands out is Sra. Josefa, who sells “chipas” (cheese bread), which is a traditional Paraguayan food. She is requesting a loan so that she can have her own shop where she can prepare and sells “chipas”. This will help to increase her monthly income.

Josefa is a hardworking person who strives to grow and move forward. She wants to receive training so that she can improve each day.

loans.use: to acquire a shop where she can prepare and sell cheese bread.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 34-year-old married Palestinian man and a father of two children. He has been working in jewelry repair and maintenance since 2008 to cover the needs and expenses of his beloved family.

Bilal is a hard worker, talented, and experienced in his domain. He is well known in the region. He has a good reputation, especially concerning his integrity while dealing in such a business.

Bilal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy raw materials which help him design and produce special jewelry to satisfy his customers' needs. 

This step forward will improve Bilal's earning potential and will encourage him to elevate his working production to a higher level, especially since he has the necessary skills requested for this kind of business.

Bilal hopes to open a showroom that will attract a lot of customers and attention to his own handmade designs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials which help him design and produce special jewelry to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gilda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gilda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, chips, etc for her general store business.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, chips, etc

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 56 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, Shirley works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Shirley has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie has a rice vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Etleva

texts.en:
This time, Etleva wants to invest in equipment to be used in her profession and also to buy chairs for the hair salon. 

"The loan helped me so much because I had come to the point that I needed financial help and did not know who to ask for it. I want to thank lenders for being wonderful with me.", Etleva said to the branch assistant who interviewed her.

loans.use: to buy equipment and chairs needed in her hair salon.

loans.name: Lira

texts.en:
Lira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Lira has been in this business for one year now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains.

In the future, Lira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains

loans.name: Mourice's Group

texts.en:
Mourice is 50 years old and has six children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Mourice is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Mourice started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. Mourice is also receiving a solar light which he is so excited about because he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, therefore saving more money.

Mourice’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres of land and 11 solar lights between them.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, two children and a pensioner mother. 

Besik is actively involved in agricultural activities. He owns a plot of agricultural land, where he grows vegetables to sell. Besik is a very hardworking man, and does his best to ensure a good harvest. 

He wants to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,200 USD. With the received credit he will purchase a cow and feed for it. 

The family will start producing dairy products and will be able to generate additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Abcede

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Abcede works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Abcede is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Abcede has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Jacklyne's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Jacklyne, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to three children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Jacklyne joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. 

With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Jacklyne plans to send her children to school and since she will also be receiving a solar light, she is so excited because she now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study.

Between the 11 farmers in Jacklyne's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. In addition, the group will also be receiving a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy one dairy cow

loans.name: Mamagul

texts.ru:
Мамагул 49 летняя жительница района Пяндж. Она проживает здесь давно. Мамагул в родном районе занимается растениеводством. Этой деятельности она занята уже 15 лет. В этой работе ей нравиться, то что  она может заработать своим честно нажитым  трудом. 
На данный момент все сельские жители уже закончили посев  урожая, и Мамагул не стало исключением. Она закончила посев и сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю с минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый урожай. Для купли минеральных удобрений у нее нет денег. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Мамагул обратилась за кредитом. Мамагул верит и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamagul is a 49-year-old resident of the Pyandj district. She has lived there for a long time. Mamagul has been planting crops in her native region for 15 years. She enjoys her work and being able to earn an honest living. 

Currently all of the farmers have already finished planting, and Mamagul is no exception. She finished planting and now she needs to treat the land with fertilizers in order to obtain a rich harvest. She does not have money to buy fertilizers, so she applied for a loan. Mamagul trusts in and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to treat the land

loans.name: 3 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El comité 3 DE MARZO es un grupo antiguo y numeroso que cuenta con 21 integrantes, se encuentran en el quinto ciclo, todas muy trabajadoras e independientes. Las mismas están muy agradecidas por formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la señora Celsa, ella es muy guapa y emprendedora, trabaja de manera independiente en la fábrica de dulces variados y las vende con la ayuda de sus hijos. Es una muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para comprar insumos para la venta de sus dulces, como ser frutas, azúcar, esencias y otros.
texts.en:
The committee named “3 de Marzo” (March 3rd) is a large longtime group that has 21 members participating in their fifth loan cycle. All of the members are hardworking and independent. They are extremely grateful to be part of the Women’s Committee Program.

One of the committee members is Sra. Celsa, who is a beautiful and enterprising woman. She works independently by making various types of sweets and then sells them with the help of her children. Celsa is very good at what she does, so she works hard at it.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for selling her sweets such as fruit, sugar, essences, and other items.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, essences, and other supplies for making sweets.

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru: Гулзина, 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулзины- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гулзины на сегодняшний день имеется 12 коров и 0,86 Га земли, где Гулзина выращивает клевер для реализации. Гулзина обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Гулзина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulzina is 29, married, and is raising two children with her spouse. Gulzina has a vocational education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops. Thanks to her hard work she currently has 12 cows and a 0.86 hectare plot of land where she grows clover to sell. Gulzina applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy three cows. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy three cows and increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Jessina

texts.en:
Jessina is 42 years old and has three children. She is married, and her three children are in school.

Jessina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.
